H3588כִּ֠יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֠יkî for Conj
H518אִ֣ם’im   (Conj)
H518 אִם ʼim eem a primitive particle; used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not; (and, can-, doubtless, if, that) (not), phrase but, either, phrase except, phrase more(-over if, than), neither, nevertheless, nor, oh that, or, phrase save (only, -ing), seeing, since, sith, phrase surely (no more, none, not), though, phrase of a truth, phrase unless, phrase verily, when, whereas, whether, while, phrase yet., 		אִ֣ם’im but Conj
H834אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection., 		אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer what Pro-r

15 Now when the turn of Esther, the daughter of Abihail the uncle of Mordecai, who had taken her for his daughter, was come to go in to the king, she not requiredhing but what Hegai the king's chamberlain, the keeper of the women, appointed. And Esther obtained favour in the sight of all them that looked upon her.Esther 2:15
Stats
Counts: 314 characters, 51 words, 248 letters, 97 vowels, 151 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּבְהַגִּ֣יעַ תֹּר־אֶסְתֵּ֣ר בַּת־אֲבִיחַ֣יִל דֹּ֣ד מָרְדֳּכַ֡י אֲשֶׁר֩ לָקַֽח־לֹ֨ו לְבַ֜ת לָבֹ֣וא אֶל־הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ לֹ֤א בִקְשָׁה֙ דָּבָ֔ר כִּ֠י אִ֣ם אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֹאמַ֛ר הֵגַ֥י סְרִיס־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ שֹׁמֵ֣ר הַנָּשִׁ֑ים וַתְּהִ֤י אֶסְתֵּר֙ נֹשֵׂ֣את חֵ֔ן בְּעֵינֵ֖י כָּל־רֹאֶֽיהָ׃

Lit: And when came the turn for Esther the daughter of Abihail the uncle of Mordecai who had taken her as his daughter to go in to the king nothing she requested nothing for but what advised Hegai eunuch of the king the custodian of the women and Esther obtained favor in the sight of all who saw her

KJV: Now when the turn of Esther, the daughter of Abihail the uncle of Mordecai, who had taken her for his daughter, was come to go in unto the king, she required nothing but what Hegai the king's chamberlain, the keeper of the women, appointed. And Esther obtained favour in the sight of all them that looked upon her.

"Esther"
Song 6:9: My dove: my undefiled is but one; she is the only one of her mother: she is the choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her: and blessed her; yes: the queens and the concubines: and they praised her.
Song 8:10: I am a wall: and my breasts like towers: then was I in his eyes as one that found favour.
Ac 7:10: Delivered him out of all his afflictions: and gave him favour and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt; and he made him governor over Egypt and all his house.

16 So Esther was taken to king Ahasuerus into his house royal in the tenth month, which is the month Tebeth, in the seventh year of his reign.Esther 2:16
Stats
Counts: 141 characters, 25 words, 112 letters, 42 vowels, 70 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַתִּלָּקַ֨ח אֶסְתֵּ֜ר אֶל־הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית מַלְכוּתֹ֔ו בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ הָעֲשִׂירִ֖י הוּא־חֹ֣דֶשׁ טֵבֵ֑ת בִּשְׁנַת־שֶׁ֖בַע לְמַלְכוּתֹֽו׃

Lit: So was taken Esther to King Ahasuerus into his palace royal in the month tenth that is the month of Tebeth in year seven of his reign

KJV: So Esther was taken unto king Ahasuerus into his house royal in the tenth month, which is the month Tebeth, in the seventh year of his reign.
References

"the tenth month"
Es 8:9: Then were the king's scribes called at that time in the third month: that is: the month Sivan: on the 3 and twentieth day thereof; and it was written according to all that Mordecai commanded to the Jews: and to the lieutenants: and the deputies and rulers of the provinces which are from India to Ethiopia: 127 provinces: to every province according to the writing thereof: and to every people after their language: and to the Jews according to their writing: and according to their language.

"the seventh"
Es 2:1: 3: After these things: when the wrath of king Ahasuerus was appeased: he remembered Vashti: and what she had done: and what was decreed against her.
Ezr 7:8: He came to Jerusalem in the fifth month: which was in the seventh year of the king.

Esther Becomes Queen

וַיֶּאֱהַ֨ב הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ אֶת־אֶסְתֵּר֙ מִכָּל־הַנָּשִׁ֔ים וַתִּשָּׂא־חֵ֥ן וָחֶ֛סֶד לְפָנָ֖יו מִכָּל־הַבְּתוּלֹ֑ת וַיָּ֤שֶׂם כֶּֽתֶר־מַלְכוּת֙ בְּרֹאשָׁ֔הּ וַיַּמְלִיכֶ֖הָ תַּ֥חַת וַשְׁתִּֽי׃

H2060וַשְׁתִּֽי׃waš-tî.   (N-proper-ms)
H2060 וַשְׁתִּי Vashtîy vash-tee of Persian origin; Vashti, the queen of Xerxes; Vashti. z 		וַשְׁתִּֽי׃waš-tî. of Vashti N-proper-ms
17 The king loved Esther above all the women, and she obtained grace and favour in his sight more than all the virgins; so that he set the royal crown upon her head, and made her queen instead of Vashti.Esther 2:17
Stats
Counts: 204 characters, 37 words, 161 letters, 62 vowels, 99 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיֶּאֱהַ֨ב הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ אֶת־אֶסְתֵּר֙ מִכָּל־הַנָּשִׁ֔ים וַתִּשָּׂא־חֵ֥ן וָחֶ֛סֶד לְפָנָ֖יו מִכָּל־הַבְּתוּלֹ֑ת וַיָּ֤שֶׂם כֶּֽתֶר־מַלְכוּת֙ בְּרֹאשָׁ֔הּ וַיַּמְלִיכֶ֖הָ תַּ֥חַת וַשְׁתִּֽי׃

Lit: And loved the king Esther more than all the other women and she obtained grace and favor in his sight more than all the virgins so he set crown the royal upon her head and made her queen instead of Vashti

KJV: And the king loved Esther above all the women, and she obtained grace and favour in his sight more than all the virgins; so that he set the royal crown upon her head, and made her queen instead of Vashti.
References

"so that he set"
Es 4:14: For if you altogether hold your peace at this time: then will there enlargement and deliverance arise to the Jews from another place; but you and your father's house will be destroyed: and who knows whether you are come to the kingdom for such a time as this?
1Sa 2:8: He raises up the poor out of the dust: and lifts up the beggar from the dunghill: to set them among princes: and to make them inherit the throne of glory: for the pillars of the earth are the LORD's: and He has set the world upon them.
Ps 75:6: 7: For promotion cometh neither from the east: nor from the west: nor from the south.
Ps 113:7: 8: He raises up the poor out of the dust: and lifts the needy out of the dunghill;
Eze 17:24: All the trees of the field will know that I the LORD have brought down the high tree: have exalted the low tree: have dried up the green tree: and have made the dry tree to flourish: I the LORD have spoken and have done it.
Lu 1:48-52: For he has regarded the low estate of his handmaiden: for: look: from henceforth all generations will call me blessed.

 וַיַּ֨עַשׂ הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ מִשְׁתֶּ֣ה גָדֹ֗ול לְכָל־שָׂרָיו֙ וַעֲבָדָ֔יו אֵ֖ת מִשְׁתֵּ֣ה אֶסְתֵּ֑ר וַהֲנָחָ֤ה לַמְּדִינֹות֙ עָשָׂ֔ה וַיִּתֵּ֥ן מַשְׂאֵ֖ת כְּיַ֥ד הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃

Stats
Counts: 184 characters, 31 words, 144 letters, 54 vowels, 90 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ מִשְׁתֶּ֣ה גָדֹ֗ול לְכָל־שָׂרָיו֙ וַעֲבָדָ֔יו אֵ֖ת מִשְׁתֵּ֣ה אֶסְתֵּ֑ר וַהֲנָחָ֤ה לַמְּדִינֹות֙ עָשָׂ֔ה וַיִּתֵּ֥ן מַשְׂאֵ֖ת כְּיַ֥ד הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃

Lit: And made the king feast a great for all his officials and servants the Feast of Esther and a holiday in the provinces he proclaimed and gave gifts according to generosity of the king

KJV: Then the king made a great feast unto all his princes and his servants, even Esther's feast; and he made a release to the provinces, and gave gifts, according to the state of the king.
References

"A. M. 3547. B.C. 457. made a great"

Ge 29:22: Laban gathered together all the men of the place: and made a feast.
Jg 14:10-17: So his father went down to the woman: and Samson made there a feast; for so used the young men to do.
Song 3:11: Go forth: O you daughters of Zion: and look king Solomon with the crown wherewith his mother crowned him in the day of his espousals: and in the day of the gladness of his heart.
Song 5:1: I am come into my garden: my sister: my spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: eat: O friends; drink: yes: drink abundantly: O beloved.
Mt 22:2: The kingdom of heaven is like to a certain king: which made a marriage for his son:
Lu 14:8: When you are bidden of any man to a wedding: not sit down in the high room; lest a more honourable man than you be bidden of him;
Re 19:9: He says to me: Write: Blessed are they which are called to the marriage supper of the Lamb. And He says to me: These are the true sayings of God.

"gave gifts"
Es 9:22: As the days wherein the Jews rested from their enemies: and the month which was turned to them from sorrow to joy: and from mourning into a good day: that they should make them days of feasting and joy: and of sending portions one to another: and gifts to the poor.

19 When the virgins were gathered together the second time, then Mordecai sat in the king's gate.Esther 2:19
Stats
Counts: 98 characters, 16 words, 79 letters, 29 vowels, 50 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּבְהִקָּבֵ֥ץ בְּתוּלֹ֖ות שֵׁנִ֑ית וּמָרְדֳּכַ֖י יֹשֵׁ֥ב בְּשַֽׁעַר־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃

Lit: And when were gathered together virgins a second time and Mordecai sat within gate of the king

KJV: And when the virgins were gathered together the second time, then Mordecai sat in the king's gate.
References

"the virgins"

"sat in the king's gate"
Es 2:21: In those days: while Mordecai sat in the king's gate: two of the king's chamberlains: Bigthan and Teresh: of those which kept the door: were angry: and sought to lay hand on the king Ahasuerus.

Es 5:13: Yet all this availeth not mehing: so long as I see Mordecai the Jew sitting at the king's gate.

20 Esther not had yet showed her kindred nor her people; as Mordecai had charged her: for Esther did the commandment of Mordecai, like as when she was brought up with him.Esther 2:20
Stats
Counts: 168 characters, 28 words, 134 letters, 48 vowels, 86 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֵ֣ין אֶסְתֵּ֗ר מַגֶּ֤דֶת מֹֽולַדְתָּהּ֙ וְאֶת־עַמָּ֔הּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה עָלֶ֖יהָ מָרְדֳּכָ֑י וְאֶת־מַאֲמַ֤ר מָרְדֳּכַי֙ אֶסְתֵּ֣ר עֹשָׂ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר הָיְתָ֥ה בְאָמְנָ֖ה אִתֹּֽו׃ ס

Lit: Now not Esther had revealed her family and her people just as had charged her Mordecai for the command of Mordecai Esther obeyed as when she was in guardianship under him

KJV: Esther had not yet shewed her kindred nor her people; as Mordecai had charged her: for Esther did the commandment of Mordecai, like as when she was brought up with him.
References

"for Esther"
Eph 6:1-3: Children: obey your parents in the Lord: for this is right.

Mordecai Uncovers a Conspiracy

בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם וּמָרְדֳּכַ֖י יֹשֵׁ֣ב בְּשַֽׁעַר־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ קָצַף֩ בִּגְתָ֨ן וָתֶ֜רֶשׁ שְׁנֵֽי־סָרִיסֵ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ מִשֹּׁמְרֵ֣י הַסַּ֔ף וַיְבַקְשׁוּ֙ לִשְׁלֹ֣חַ יָ֔ד בַּמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵֽרֹשׁ׃

H3117בַּיָּמִ֣יםbay-yā-mîm   (Prep-b, Art | N-mp)
H3117 יוֹם yôwm yome from an unused root meaning to be hot; a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb); age, phrase always, phrase chronicals, continually(-ance), daily, ((birth-), each, to) day, (now a, two) days (agone), phrase elder, idiom end, phrase evening, phrase (for) ever(-lasting, -more), idiom full, life, as (so) long as (... live), (even) now, phrase old, phrase outlived, phrase perpetually, presently, phrase remaineth, idiom required, season, idiom since, space, then, (process of) time, phrase as at other times, phrase in trouble, weather, (as) when, (a, the, within a) while (that), idiom whole (phrase age), (full) year(-ly), phrase younger. 		בַּיָּמִ֣יםbay-yā-mîm In days Prep-b, Art | N-mp

H5631סָרִיסֵ֤יsā-rî-sê   (N-mpc)
H5631 סָרִיס çârîyç saw-reece or סָרִס; from an unused root meaning to castrate; a eunuch; by implication, valet (especially of the female apartments), and thus, a minister of state; chamberlain, eunuch, officer. Compare רַב־סָרִיס. 		סָרִיסֵ֤יsā-rî-sê of eunuchs N-mpc

H325אֲחַשְׁוֵֽרֹשׁ׃’ă-ḥaš-wê-rōš.   (N-proper-ms)
H325 אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ ʼĂchashvêrôwsh akh-ash-vay-rosh or (shortened) אַחַשְׁרֹשׁ (Esther 10:1); of Persian origin; Achashverosh (i.e. Ahasuerus or Artaxerxes, but in this case Xerxes), the title (rather than name) of a Persian king; Ahasuerus. 		אֲחַשְׁוֵֽרֹשׁ׃’ă-ḥaš-wê-rōš. Ahasuerus N-proper-ms
21 In those days, while Mordecai sat in the king's gate, two of the king's chamberlains, Bigthan and Teresh, of those which kept the door, were angry, and sought to lay hand on the king Ahasuerus.Esther 2:21
Stats
Counts: 193 characters, 29 words, 150 letters, 54 vowels, 96 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם וּמָרְדֳּכַ֖י יֹשֵׁ֣ב בְּשַֽׁעַר־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ קָצַף֩ בִּגְתָ֨ן וָתֶ֜רֶשׁ שְׁנֵֽי־סָרִיסֵ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ מִשֹּׁמְרֵ֣י הַסַּ֔ף וַיְבַקְשׁוּ֙ לִשְׁלֹ֣חַ יָ֔ד בַּמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵֽרֹשׁ׃

Lit: In days those and while Mordecai sat within gate of the king became furious Bigthan and Teresh two of eunuchs of the king doorkeepers the door and sought to lay hands on King Ahasuerus

KJV: In those days, while Mordecai sat in the king's gate, two of the king's chamberlains, Bigthan and Teresh, of those which kept the door, were wroth, and sought to lay hand on the king Ahasuerus.
References

"Bigthan"
Es 6:2: It was found written: that Mordecai had told of Bigthana and Teresh: two of the king's chamberlains: the keepers of the door: who sought to lay hand on the king Ahasuerus.

"and sought"
2Sa 4:5: 6: The sons of Rimmon the Beerothite: Rechab and Baanah: went: and came about the heat of the day to the house of Ishbosheth: who lay on a bed at noon.
2Sa 16:11: David said to Abishai: and to all His servants: Look: my son: which came forth of my bowels: seeks my life: how much more now may this Benjamite do it? let Him alone: and let Him curse; for the LORD has bidden Him.
1Ki 15:25-27: Nadab the son of Jeroboam began to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah: and reigned over Israel two years.
1Ki 16:9: His servant Zimri: captain of half his chariots: conspired against him: as he was in Tirzah: drinking himself drunk in the house of Arza steward of his house in Tirzah.
2Ki 9:22-24: It came to pass: when Joram saw Jehu: that he said: Is it peace: Jehu? And he answered: What peace: so long as the whoredoms of your mother Jezebel and her witchcrafts are so many?
2Ki 12:20: His servants arose: and made a conspiracy: and killed Joash in the house of Millo: which goes down to Silla.
2Ki 21:23: The servants of Amon conspired against him: and killed the king in his own house.
Ps 144:10: It is he that gives salvation to kings: who delivers David his servant from the hurtful sword.

22 The thing was known to Mordecai, who told it to Esther the queen; and Esther certified the king thereof in Mordecai's name.Esther 2:22
Stats
Counts: 131 characters, 19 words, 103 letters, 40 vowels, 63 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיִּוָּדַ֤ע הַדָּבָר֙ לְמָרְדֳּכַ֔י וַיַּגֵּ֖ד לְאֶסְתֵּ֣ר הַמַּלְכָּ֑ה וַתֹּ֧אמֶר אֶסְתֵּ֛ר לַמֶּ֖לֶךְ בְּשֵׁ֥ם מָרְדֳּכָֽי׃

Lit: So became known the matter to Mordecai and who told Esther Queen and informed Esther the king in name of Mordecai

KJV: And the thing was known to Mordecai, who told it unto Esther the queen; and Esther certified the king [thereof] in Mordecai's name.

"the thing"

"and Esther certified"

"Mordecai's name"

H4428הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ham-me-leḵ.   (Art | N-ms)
H4428 מֶלֶךְ melek meh-lek from מָלַךְ; a king; king, royal. 		הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ham-me-leḵ. of the king Art | N-ms
23 When inquisition was made of the matter, it was found out; therefore they were both hanged on a tree: and it was written in the book of the chronicles before the king.Esther 2:23
Stats
Counts: 171 characters, 30 words, 135 letters, 54 vowels, 81 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיְבֻקַּ֤שׁ הַדָּבָר֙ וַיִּמָּצֵ֔א וַיִּתָּל֥וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־עֵ֑ץ וַיִּכָּתֵ֗ב בְּסֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לִפְנֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ פ

Lit: And when an inquiry was made into the matter and it was confirmed and were hanged the two of them on a gallows and it was written in the book of the chronicles in the presence of the king

KJV: And when inquisition was made of the matter, it was found out; therefore they were both hanged on a tree: and it was written in the book of the chronicles before the king.
References

"hanged"
Es 5:14: Then said Zeresh his wife and all his friends to him: Let a gallows be made of 50 cubits high: and to morrow speak you to the king that Mordecai may be hanged thereon: then go you in merrily with the king to the banquet. And the thing pleased Haman; and he caused the gallows to be made.
Es 7:10: So they hanged Haman on the gallows that he had prepared for Mordecai. Then was the king's wrath pacified.
Ge 40:19: 22: Yet within 3 days will Pharaoh lift up your head from off you: and will hang you on a tree; and the birds will eat your flesh from off you.
De 21:22: 23: If a man have committed a sin worthy of death: and he be to be put to death: and you hang him on a tree:
Jos 8:29: The king of Ai he hanged on a tree until eventide: and as soon as the sun was down: Joshua commanded that they should take his carcase down from the tree: and cast it at the entering of the gate of the city: and raise thereon a great heap of stones: that remaineth to this day.

"the book"
Es 6:1: 2: On that night not could the king sleep: and he commanded to bring the book of records of the chronicles; and they were read before the king.
Mal 3:16: Then they that feared the LORD spoke often one to another: and the LORD listened: and heard it: and a book of remembrance was written before Him for them that feared the LORD: and that thought upon His name.

3
Haman’s Plot against the Jews

Haman Elevated

אַחַ֣ר ׀ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה גִּדַּל֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹ֜ושׁ אֶת־הָמָ֧ן בֶּֽן־הַמְּדָ֛תָא הָאֲגָגִ֖י וַֽיְנַשְּׂאֵ֑הוּ וַיָּ֙שֶׂם֙ אֶת־כִּסְאֹ֔ו מֵעַ֕ל כָּל־הַשָּׂרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתֹּֽו׃

H834אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). 1 After these things did king Ahasuerus promote Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, and advanced him, and set his seat above all the princes that were with him.Esther 3:1
Stats
Rank: #8121 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 163 characters, 27 words, 132 letters, 51 vowels, 81 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אַחַ֣ר ׀ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה גִּדַּל֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹ֜ושׁ אֶת־הָמָ֧ן בֶּֽן־הַמְּדָ֛תָא הָאֲגָגִ֖י וַֽיְנַשְּׂאֵ֑הוּ וַיָּ֙שֶׂם֙ אֶת־כִּסְאֹ֔ו מֵעַ֕ל כָּל־הַשָּׂרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתֹּֽו׃

Lit: After things these promoted King Ahasuerus Haman son of Hammedatha the Agagite and advanced him and set his seat above all the princes who were with him

KJV: After these things did king Ahasuerus promote Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, and advanced him, and set his seat above all the princes that were with him.
References

"A. M. 3551. B.C. 453. promote Haman"
Es 7:6: Esther said: The adversary and enemy is this wicked Haman. Then Haman was afraid before the king and the queen.
Ps 12:8: The wicked walk on every side: when the vile men are exalted.
Pr 29:2: When the righteous are in authority: the people rejoice: but when the wicked bears rule: the people mourn.

"Agagite"
Nu 24:7: He will pour the water out of his buckets: and his seed will be in many waters: and his king will be higher than Agag: and his kingdom will be exalted.
1Sa 15:8: 33: He took Agag the king of the Amalekites alive: and utterly destroyed all the people with the edge of the sword.

"above all the princes"
Es 1:14: The next to him was Carshena: Shethar: Admatha: Tarshish: Meres: Marsena: and Memucan: the 7 princes of Persia and Media: which saw the king's face: and which sat the first in the kingdom;)
Ge 41:40: 55: You will be over my house: and according to your word will all my people be ruled: only in the throne will I be greater than you.
Ezr 7:14: Forasmuch as you are sent of the king: and of His 7 counsellers: to inquire concerning Judah and Jerusalem: according to the law of your God which is in your hand;
Da 6:2: Over these 3 presidents; of whom Daniel was first: that the princes might give accounts to them: and the king should have no damage.

H3588כִּי־kî-   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּי־kî- for Conj
H3651כֵ֖ןḵên   (Adv)

H7812 שָׁחָה shâchâh shaw-khaw a primitive root; to depress, i.e. prostrate (especially reflexive, in homage to royalty or God); bow (self) down, crouch, fall down (flat), humbly beseech, do (make) obeisance, do reverence, make to stoop, worship. 		יִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶֽה׃yiš-ta-ḥă-weh. pay homage V-Hitpael-Imperf-3ms
2 All the king's servants, that were in the king's gate, bowed, and reverenced Haman: for the king had so commanded concerning him. But Mordecai not bowed, nor did him reverence.Esther 3:2
Stats
Counts: 182 characters, 23 words, 141 letters, 50 vowels, 91 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְכָל־עַבְדֵ֨י הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֲשֶׁר־בְּשַׁ֣עַר הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ כֹּרְעִ֤ים וּמִֽשְׁתַּחֲוִים֙ לְהָמָ֔ן כִּי־כֵ֖ן צִוָּה־לֹ֣ו הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וּמָ֨רְדֳּכַ֔י לֹ֥א יִכְרַ֖ע וְלֹ֥א יִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶֽה׃

Lit: And all servants of the king who were within gate of the king bowed and paid homage to Haman for so had commanded concerning him the king but Mordecai not would bow or pay homage

KJV: And all the king's servants, that were in the king's gate, bowed, and reverenced Haman: for the king had so commanded concerning him. But Mordecai bowed not, nor did [him] reverence.
References

"the king's servants"
Es 2:19: 21: When the virgins were gathered together the second time: then Mordecai sat in the king's gate.

"bowed"
Ge 41:43: He made him to ride in the second chariot which he had; and they cried before him: Bow the knee: and he made him ruler over all the land of Egypt.
Php 2:10: That at the name of Jesus every knee should bow: of things in heaven: and things in earth: and things under the earth;

"bowed not"
Es 3:1: 5: After these things did king Ahasuerus promote Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite: and advanced him: and set his seat above all the princes that were with him.
Ex 17:14: 16: The LORD said to Moses: Write this for a memorial in a book: and rehearse it in the ears of Joshua: for I will utterly put out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.
De 25:19: Therefore it will be: when the LORD your God has given you rest from all your enemies round about: in the land which the LORD your God gives you for an inheritance to possess it: that you will blot out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven; you will not forget it.
1Sa 15:3: Now go and smite Amalek: and utterly destroy all that they have: and spare not them; but kill both man and woman: infant and suckling: ox and sheep: camel and ass.
Ps 15:4: In whose eyes a vile person is contemned; but He honours them that fear the LORD. He who swears to His own hurt: and changes not.

3 Then the king's servants, which were in the king's gate, said to Mordecai, Why transgress you the king's commandment?Esther 3:3
Stats
Counts: 123 characters, 16 words, 98 letters, 31 vowels, 67 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמְר֜וּ עַבְדֵ֥י הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ אֲשֶׁר־בְּשַׁ֥עַר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ לְמָרְדֳּכָ֑י מַדּ֙וּעַ֙ אַתָּ֣ה עֹובֵ֔ר אֵ֖ת מִצְוַ֥ת הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃

Lit: And said servants of the king who were within gate of the king to Mordecai why you do transgress command of the king

KJV: Then the king's servants, which were in the king's gate, said unto Mordecai, Why transgressest thou the king's commandment?
References

"Why"
Es 3:2: All the king's servants: that were in the king's gate: bowed: and reverenced Haman: for the king had so commanded concerning him. But Mordecai not bowed: nor did him reverence.
Ex 1:17: But the midwives feared God: and not did as the king of Egypt commanded them: but saved the men children alive.
Mt 15:2: 3: Why do your disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? for they not wash their hands when they eat bread.

H5046 נָגַד nâgad naw-gad a primitive root; properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise; bewray, idiom certainly, certify, declare(-ing), denounce, expound, idiom fully, messenger, plainly, profess, rehearse, report, shew (forth), speak, idiom surely, tell, utter. 		וַיַּגִּ֣ידוּway-yag-gî-ḏū that they told it Conj-w | V-Hifil-ConsecImperf-3mp

H834אֲשֶׁר־’ă-šer-   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). H1931ה֥וּאhū   (Pro-3ms)
H1931 הוּא hûwʼ hoo of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who., 		ה֥וּאhū he was Pro-3ms

4 Now it came to pass, when they spoke daily to him, and he listened not to them, that they told Haman, to see whether Mordecai's matters would stand: for he had told them that he was a Jew.Esther 3:4
Stats
Rank: #3812 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 193 characters, 33 words, 149 letters, 54 vowels, 95 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י [בְּאָמְרָם כ] (כְּאָמְרָ֤ם ק) אֵלָיו֙ יֹ֣ום וָיֹ֔ום וְלֹ֥א שָׁמַ֖ע אֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וַיַּגִּ֣ידוּ לְהָמָ֗ן לִרְאֹות֙ הֲיַֽעַמְדוּ֙ דִּבְרֵ֣י מָרְדֳּכַ֔י כִּֽי־הִגִּ֥יד לָהֶ֖ם אֲשֶׁר־ה֥וּא יְהוּדִֽי׃

Lit: and it came to pass when they spoke to him day and daily and not he would listen to them that they told it to Haman to see whether would stand words of Mordecai for Mordecai had told them that he was a Jew

KJV: Now it came to pass, when they spake daily unto him, and he hearkened not unto them, that they told Haman, to see whether Mordecai's matters would stand: for he had told them that he was a Jew.
References

"when they spake"
Ge 39:10: It came to pass: as she spoke to Joseph day by day: that he listened not to her: to lie by her: or to be with her.

"that they told"
Da 3:8: 9: For what reason at that time certain Chaldeans came near: and accused the Jews.
Da 6:13: Then answered they and said before the king: That Daniel: which is of the children of the captivity of Judah: regards not you: O king: nor the decree that you have signed: but makes his petition 3 times a day.

"he had told"
Ezr 1:3: Who is there among you of all His people? His God be with Him: and let Him go up to Jerusalem: which is in Judah: and build the house of the LORD God of Israel: (He is the God: ) which is in Jerusalem.
Da 3:12: 16-18: 23-30: There are certain Jews whom you have set over the affairs of the province of Babylon: Shadrach: Meshach: and Abednego; these men: O king: not have regarded you: they not serve your gods: nor worship the golden image which you have set up.
Da 6:20-28: When He came to the den: He cried with a lamentable voice to Daniel: and the king spoke and said to Daniel: O Daniel: servant of the living God: is your God: whom you serve continually: able to deliver you from the lions?
Jon 1:9: He said to them: I am an Hebrew; and I fear the LORD: the God of heaven: which has made the sea and the dry land.

5 When Haman saw that Mordecai not bowed, nor did him reverence, then was Haman full of wrath.Esther 3:5
Stats
Rank: #4793 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 96 characters, 16 words, 76 letters, 27 vowels, 49 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא הָמָ֔ן כִּי־אֵ֣ין מָרְדֳּכַ֔י כֹּרֵ֥עַ וּמִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֖ה לֹ֑ו וַיִּמָּלֵ֥א הָמָ֖ן חֵמָֽה׃

Lit: And when saw Haman that not Mordecai did bow or pay homage him and was filled Haman with wrath

KJV: And when Haman saw that Mordecai bowed not, nor did him reverence, then was Haman full of wrath.
References

"that Mordecai"
Es 3:2: All the king's servants: that were in the king's gate: bowed: and reverenced Haman: for the king had so commanded concerning him. But Mordecai not bowed: nor did him reverence.
Es 5:9: Then went Haman forth that day joyful and with a glad heart: but when Haman saw Mordecai in the king's gate: that he not stood up: nor moved for him: he was full of indignation against Mordecai.

"full of wrath"
Es 1:12: But the queen Vashti refused to come at the king's commandment by his chamberlains: therefore was the king very angry: and his anger burned in him.
Ge 4:5: 6: But to Cain and to his offering he not had respect. And Cain was very angry: and his face fell.
Job 5:2: For wrath kills the foolish man: and envy slays the silly one.
Pr 12:16: A fool's wrath is presently known: but a prudent man covers shame.
Pr 19:19: A man of great wrath will suffer punishment: for if you deliver him: yet you must do it again.
Pr 21:24: Proud and haughty scorner is his name: who deals in proud wrath.
Pr 27:3: 4: A stone is heavy: and the sand weighty; but a fool's wrath is heavier than them both.
Da 3:19: Then was Nebuchadnezzar full of fury: and the form of his visage was changed against Shadrach: Meshach: and Abednego: therefore he spoke: and commanded that they should heat the furnace 8 times more than it was wont to be heated.

H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). 6 He thought scorn to lay hands on Mordecai alone; for they had showed him the people of Mordecai: for what reason Haman sought to destroy all the Jews that were throughout the whole kingdom of Ahasuerus, even the people of Mordecai.Esther 3:6
Stats
Rank: #6521 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 231 characters, 36 words, 186 letters, 74 vowels, 112 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיִּ֣בֶז בְּעֵינָ֗יו לִשְׁלֹ֤ח יָד֙ בְּמָרְדֳּכַ֣י לְבַדֹּ֔ו כִּֽי־הִגִּ֥ידוּ לֹ֖ו אֶת־עַ֣ם מָרְדֳּכָ֑י וַיְבַקֵּ֣שׁ הָמָ֗ן לְהַשְׁמִ֧יד אֶת־כָּל־הַיְּהוּדִ֛ים אֲשֶׁ֛ר בְּכָל־מַלְכ֥וּת אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹ֖ושׁ עַ֥ם מָרְדֳּכָֽי׃

Lit: But he disdained eye to lay hands on Mordecai alone for they had told him of the people of Mordecai and Instead sought Haman to destroy all the Jews who were throughout the whole kingdom of Ahasuerus the people of Mordecai

KJV: And he thought scorn to lay hands on Mordecai alone; for they had shewed him the people of Mordecai: wherefore Haman sought to destroy all the Jews that were throughout the whole kingdom of Ahasuerus, [even] the people of Mordecai.
References

"sought"
Ps 83:4: They have said: Come: and let us cut them off from being a nation; that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.
Re 12:12: Therefore rejoice: you heavens: and you that dwell in them. Woe to the inhabiters of the earth and of the sea! for the devil is come down to you: having great wrath: because he knows that he has but a short time.

 בַּחֹ֤דֶשׁ הָרִאשֹׁון֙ הוּא־חֹ֣דֶשׁ נִיסָ֔ן בִּשְׁנַת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣ים עֶשְׂרֵ֔ה לַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹ֑ושׁ הִפִּ֣יל פּוּר֩ ה֨וּא הַגֹּורָ֜ל לִפְנֵ֣י הָמָ֗ן מִיֹּ֧ום ׀ לְיֹ֛ום וּמֵחֹ֛דֶשׁ לְחֹ֥דֶשׁ שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֖ר הוּא־חֹ֥דֶשׁ אֲדָֽר׃ ס

H143אֲדָֽר׃’ă-ḏār.   (N-proper-fs)
H143 אֲדָר ʼĂdâr ad-awr probably of foreign derivation; perhaps meaning fire; Adar, the 12th Hebrew month; Adar. 		אֲדָֽר׃’ă-ḏār. of Adar N-proper-fs
7 In the first month, that is, the month Nisan, in the twelfth year of king Ahasuerus, they cast Pur, that is, the lot, before Haman from day today, and from month to month, to the twelfth month, that is, the month Adar.Esther 3:7
Stats
Rank: #6990 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 227 characters, 28 words, 165 letters, 53 vowels, 112 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בַּחֹ֤דֶשׁ הָרִאשֹׁון֙ הוּא־חֹ֣דֶשׁ נִיסָ֔ן בִּשְׁנַת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣ים עֶשְׂרֵ֔ה לַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹ֑ושׁ הִפִּ֣יל פּוּר֩ ה֨וּא הַגֹּורָ֜ל לִפְנֵ֣י הָמָ֗ן מִיֹּ֧ום ׀ לְיֹ֛ום וּמֵחֹ֛דֶשׁ לְחֹ֥דֶשׁ שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֖ר הוּא־חֹ֥דֶשׁ אֲדָֽר׃ ס

Lit: In month the first that is the month of Nisan in year two and ten of King Ahasuerus they cast Pur it is the lot before Haman days to determine the day and the month until it fell on the two and ten [month] that is the month of Adar

KJV: In the first month, that is, the month Nisan, in the twelfth year of king Ahasuerus, they cast Pur, that [is], the lot, before Haman from day to day, and from month to month, [to] the twelfth [month], that [is], the month Adar.
References

"the first month"
Ne 2:1: It came to pass in the month Nisan: in the twentieth year of Artaxerxes the king: that wine was before him: and I took up the wine: and gave it to the king. Now I not had been beforetime sad in his presence.

"in the twelfth"
Es 1:3: In the third year of his reign: he made a feast to all his princes and his servants; the power of Persia and Media: the nobles and princes of the provinces: being before him:
Es 2:16: So Esther was taken to king Ahasuerus into his house royal in the tenth month: which is the month Tebeth: in the seventh year of his reign.

"they cast Pur"
Es 9:24-26: Because Haman the son of Hammedatha: the Agagite: the enemy of all the Jews: had devised against the Jews to destroy them: and had cast Pur: that is: the lot: to consume them: and to destroy them;
Pr 16:33: The lot is cast into the lap; but the whole disposing thereof is of the LORD.
Eze 21:21: 22: For the king of Babylon stood at the parting of the way: at the head of the two ways: to use divination: he made his arrows bright: he consulted with images: he looked in the liver.
Mt 27:35: They crucified him: and parted his garments: casting lots: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet: They parted my garments among them: and upon my vesture did they cast lots.

"Adar"
Es 9:1: 5: 17-19: 21: Now in the twelfth month: that is: the month Adar: on the thirteenth day of the same: when the king's commandment and his decree drew near to be put in execution: in the day that the enemies of the Jews hoped to have power over them: (though it was turned to the contrary: that the Jews had rule over them that hated them;)
Ezr 6:15: This house was finished on the third day of the month Adar: which was in the sixth year of the reign of Darius the king.

 וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הָמָן֙ לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹ֔ושׁ יֶשְׁנֹ֣ו עַם־אֶחָ֗ד מְפֻזָּ֤ר וּמְפֹרָד֙ בֵּ֣ין הָֽעַמִּ֔ים בְּכֹ֖ל מְדִינֹ֣ות מַלְכוּתֶ֑ךָ וְדָתֵיהֶ֞ם שֹׁנֹ֣ות מִכָּל־עָ֗ם וְאֶת־דָּתֵ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֵינָ֣ם עֹשִׂ֔ים וְלַמֶּ֥לֶךְ אֵין־שֹׁוֶ֖ה לְהַנִּיחָֽם׃

H3240 יָנַח yânach yaw-nakh a primitive root; to deposit; by implication, to allow to stay; bestow, cast down, lay (down, up), leave (off), let alone (remain), pacify, place, put, set (down), suffer, withdraw, withhold. (The Hiphil forms with the dagesh are here referred to, in accordance with the older grammarians; but if any distinction of the kind is to be made, these should rather be referred to נוּחַ, and the others here.) 		לְהַנִּיחָֽם׃lə-han-nî-ḥām. to let them remain Prep-l | V-Hifil-Inf | 3mp
8 Haman said to king Ahasuerus, There is a certain people scattered abroad and dispersed among the people in all the provinces of your kingdom; and their laws are diverse from all people; neither keep they the king's laws: therefore it is not for the king's profit to suffer them.Esther 3:8
Stats
Rank: #7012 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 285 characters, 44 words, 227 letters, 87 vowels, 140 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הָמָן֙ לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹ֔ושׁ יֶשְׁנֹ֣ו עַם־אֶחָ֗ד מְפֻזָּ֤ר וּמְפֹרָד֙ בֵּ֣ין הָֽעַמִּ֔ים בְּכֹ֖ל מְדִינֹ֣ות מַלְכוּתֶ֑ךָ וְדָתֵיהֶ֞ם שֹׁנֹ֣ות מִכָּל־עָ֗ם וְאֶת־דָּתֵ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֵינָ֣ם עֹשִׂ֔ים וְלַמֶּ֥לֶךְ אֵין־שֹׁוֶ֖ה לְהַנִּיחָֽם׃

Lit: And said Haman to king Ahasuerus there is people a scattered and dispersed among the people in all the provinces of your kingdom and their laws are different from all other people and laws of the king they are not keeping therefore for the King it is not fitting to let them remain

KJV: And Haman said unto king Ahasuerus, There is a certain people scattered abroad and dispersed among the people in all the provinces of thy kingdom; and their laws are diverse from all people; neither keep they the king's laws: therefore it [is] not for the king's profit to suffer them.
References

"scattered abroad"
Le 26:33: I will scatter you among the heathen: and will draw out a sword after you: and your land will be desolate: and your cities waste.
De 4:27: The LORD will scatter you among the nations: and you will be left few in number among the heathen: whither the LORD will lead you.
De 30:3: That then the LORD your God will turn your captivity: and have compassion upon you: and will return and gather you from all the nations: whither the LORD your God has scattered you.
De 32:26: I said: I would scatter them into corners: I would make the remembrance of them to cease from among men:
Ne 1:8: Remember: I beseech you: the word that you commandedst your servant Moses: saying: If you transgress: I will scatter you abroad among the nations:
Jer 50:17: Israel is a scattered sheep; the lions have driven him away: first the king of Assyria has devoured him; and last this Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon has broken his bones.
Eze 6:8: Yet will I leave a remnant: that you may have some that will escape the sword among the nations: when you will be scattered through the countries.
Eze 11:16: Therefore say: Thus says the Lord GOD; Although I have cast them far off among the heathen: and although I have scattered them among the countries: yet will I be to them as a little sanctuary in the countries where they will come.
Zec 7:14: But I scattered them with a whirlwind among all the nations whom they not knew. Thus the land was desolate after them: that no man passed through nor returned: for they laid the pleasant land desolate.
Joh 7:35: Then said the Jews among themselves: Whither will he go: that we will not find him? will he go to the dispersed among the Gentiles: and teach the Gentiles?
Jas 1:1: James: a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ: to the 12 tribes which are scattered abroad: greeting.
1Pe 1:1: Peter: an apostle of Jesus Christ: to the strangers scattered throughout Pontus: Galatia: Cappadocia: Asia: and Bithynia:

"their laws"
Ezr 4:12-15: Be it known to the king: that the Jews which came up from you to us are come to Jerusalem: building the rebellious and the bad city: and have set up the walls thereof: and joined the foundations.
Ac 16:20: 21: Brought them to the magistrates: saying: These men: being Jews: do exceedingly trouble our city:
Ac 17:6: 7: When they found not them: they drew Jason and certain brothers to the rulers of the city: crying: These that have turned the world upside down are come here also;
Ac 24:5: For we have found this man a pestilent fellow: and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world: and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes:
Ac 28:22: But we desire to hear of you what you think: for as concerning this sect: we know that every where it is spoken against.

 אִם־עַל־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ טֹ֔וב יִכָּתֵ֖ב לְאַבְּדָ֑ם וַעֲשֶׂ֨רֶת אֲלָפִ֜ים כִּכַּר־כֶּ֗סֶף אֶשְׁקֹול֙ עַל־יְדֵי֙ עֹשֵׂ֣י הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה לְהָבִ֖יא אֶל־גִּנְזֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃

H518אִם־’im-   (Conj)
H518 אִם ʼim eem a primitive particle; used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not; (and, can-, doubtless, if, that) (not), phrase but, either, phrase except, phrase more(-over if, than), neither, nevertheless, nor, oh that, or, phrase save (only, -ing), seeing, since, sith, phrase surely (no more, none, not), though, phrase of a truth, phrase unless, phrase verily, when, whereas, whether, while, phrase yet., 		אִם־’im- If Conj

H505אֲלָפִ֜ים’ă-lā-p̄îm   (Number-mp)
H505 אֶלֶף ʼeleph eh-lef prop, the same as אֶלֶף; hence (the oxs head being the first letter of the alphabet, and this eventually used as a numeral) a thousand; thousand. 		אֲלָפִ֜ים’ă-lā-p̄îm thousand Number-mp
H3603כִּכַּר־kik-kar-   (N-fsc)
H3603 כִּכָּר kikkâr kik-kawr from כָּרַר; a circle, i.e. (by implication) a circumjacent tract or region, especially the Ghor or valley of the Jordan; also a (round) loaf; also a talent (or large round coin); loaf, morsel, piece, plain, talent. 		כִּכַּר־kik-kar- talents N-fsc

H5921 עַל ʻal al properly, the same as עַל used as a preposition (in the singular or plural often with prefix, or as conjunction with a particle following); above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications; above, according to(-ly), after, (as) against, among, and, idiom as, at, because of, beside (the rest of), between, beyond the time, idiom both and, by (reason of), idiom had the charge of, concerning for, in (that), (forth, out) of, (from) (off), (up-) on, over, than, through(-out), to, touching, idiom with., 		עַל־‘al- into Prep
H3027יְדֵי֙yə-ḏê   (N-fdc)
H3027 יָד yâd yawd a primitive word; in distinction from כַּף, the closed one); used (as noun, adverb, etc.) in a great variety of applications, both literally and figuratively, both proximate and remote (as follows); a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),; (phrase be) able, idiom about, phrase armholes, at, axletree, because of, beside, border, idiom bounty, phrase broad, (broken-) handed, idiom by, charge, coast, phrase consecrate, phrase creditor, custody, debt, dominion, idiom enough, phrase fellowship, force, idiom from, hand(-staves, -y work), idiom he, himself, idiom in, labour, phrase large, ledge, (left-) handed, means, idiom mine, ministry, near, idiom of, idiom order, ordinance, idiom our, parts, pain, power, idiom presumptuously, service, side, sore, state, stay, draw with strength, stroke, phrase swear, terror, idiom thee, idiom by them, idiom themselves, idiom thine own, idiom thou, through, idiom throwing, phrase thumb, times, idiom to, idiom under, idiom us, idiom wait on, (way-) side, where, phrase wide, idiom with (him, me, you), work, phrase yield, idiom yourselves. 		יְדֵי֙yə-ḏê the hands N-fdc
H6213עֹשֵׂ֣י‘ō-śê   (V-Qal-Prtcpl-mpc)
H6213 עָשָׂה ʻâsâh aw-saw a primitive root; to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application; accomplish, advance, appoint, apt, be at, become, bear, bestow, bring forth, bruise, be busy, idiom certainly, have the charge of, commit, deal (with), deck, phrase displease, do, (ready) dress(-ed), (put in) execute(-ion), exercise, fashion, phrase feast, (fight-) ing man, phrase finish, fit, fly, follow, fulfill, furnish, gather, get, go about, govern, grant, great, phrase hinder, hold (a feast), idiom indeed, phrase be industrious, phrase journey, keep, labour, maintain, make, be meet, observe, be occupied, offer, phrase officer, pare, bring (come) to pass, perform, pracise, prepare, procure, provide, put, requite, idiom sacrifice, serve, set, shew, idiom sin, spend, idiom surely, take, idiom thoroughly, trim, idiom very, phrase vex, be (warr-) ior, work(-man), yield, use. 		עֹשֵׂ֣י‘ō-śê of those who do V-Qal-Prtcpl-mpc
H4399הַמְּלָאכָ֔הham-mə-lā-ḵāh,   (Art | N-fs)
H4399 מְלָאכָה mᵉlâʼkâh mel-aw-kaw from the same as מֲלְאָךְ; properly, deputyship, i.e. ministry; generally, employment (never servile) or work (abstractly or concretely); also property (as the result of labor); business, phrase cattle, phrase industrious, occupation, (phrase -pied), phrase officer, thing (made), use, (manner of) work((-man), -manship). 		הַמְּלָאכָ֔הham-mə-lā-ḵāh, the work Art | N-fs

H413אֶל־’el-   (Prep)
H413 אֵל ʼêl ale (but only used in the shortened constructive form אֶל ); a primitive particle; properly, denoting motion towards, but occasionally used of a quiescent position, i.e.; near, with or among; often in general, to; about, according to, after, against, among, as for, at, because(-fore, -side), both...and, by, concerning, for, from, idiom hath, in(-to), near, (out) of, over, through, to(-ward), under, unto, upon, whether, with(-in). 		אֶל־’el- into Prep

H4428הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ham-me-leḵ.   (Art | N-ms)
H4428 מֶלֶךְ melek meh-lek from מָלַךְ; a king; king, royal. 		הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ham-me-leḵ. of the king Art | N-ms
9 If it please the king, let it be written that they may be destroyed: and I will pay 10000 talents of silver to the hands of those that have the charge of the business, to bring it into the king's treasuries.Esther 3:9
Stats
Rank: #8541 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 214 characters, 39 words, 168 letters, 61 vowels, 107 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אִם־עַל־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ טֹ֔וב יִכָּתֵ֖ב לְאַבְּדָ֑ם וַעֲשֶׂ֨רֶת אֲלָפִ֜ים כִּכַּר־כֶּ֗סֶף אֶשְׁקֹול֙ עַל־יְדֵי֙ עֹשֵׂ֣י הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה לְהָבִ֖יא אֶל־גִּנְזֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃

Lit: If on the king it pleases let a decree be written that they be destroyed and ten thousand talents of silver I will pay into the hands of those who do the work to bring it into treasuries of the king

KJV: If it please the king, let it be written that they may be destroyed: and I will pay ten thousand talents of silver to the hands of those that have the charge of the business, to bring it into the king's treasuries.
References

"that they may be destroyed"
Ge 23:16: Abraham listened to Ephron; and Abraham weighed to Ephron the silver: which he had named in the audience of the sons of Heth: 400 shekels of silver: current money with the merchant.

"ten thousand"
Mt 18:24: When he had begun to reckon: one was brought to him: which owed him 10000 talents.

 וַיָּ֧סַר הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ אֶת־טַבַּעְתֹּ֖ו מֵעַ֣ל יָדֹ֑ו וַֽיִּתְּנָ֗הּ לְהָמָ֧ן בֶּֽן־הַמְּדָ֛תָא הָאֲגָגִ֖י צֹרֵ֥ר הַיְּהוּדִֽים׃

10 The king took his ring from his hand, and gave it to Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, the Jews' enemy.Esther 3:10
Stats
Rank: #9394 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 116 characters, 20 words, 90 letters, 34 vowels, 56 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיָּ֧סַר הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ אֶת־טַבַּעְתֹּ֖ו מֵעַ֣ל יָדֹ֑ו וַֽיִּתְּנָ֗הּ לְהָמָ֧ן בֶּֽן־הַמְּדָ֛תָא הָאֲגָגִ֖י צֹרֵ֥ר הַיְּהוּדִֽים׃

Lit: So took the king his signet ring from his hand and gave it to Haman son of Hammedatha the Agagite the enemy of the Jews

KJV: And the king took his ring from his hand, and gave it unto Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, the Jews' enemy.
References

"took"
Es 8:2: 8: The king took off his ring: which he had taken from Haman: and gave it to Mordecai. And Esther set Mordecai over the house of Haman.
Ge 41:42: Pharaoh took off his ring from his hand: and put it upon Joseph's hand: and arrayed him in vestures of fine linen: and put a gold chain about his neck;

"enemy"
Es 7:6: Esther said: The adversary and enemy is this wicked Haman. Then Haman was afraid before the king and the queen.

H2896 טוֹב ṭôwb tobe from טוֹב; good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well); beautiful, best, better, bountiful, cheerful, at ease, idiom fair (word), (be in) favour, fine, glad, good (deed, -lier, -liest, -ly, -ness, -s), graciously, joyful, kindly, kindness, liketh (best), loving, merry, idiom most, pleasant, phrase pleaseth, pleasure, precious, prosperity, ready, sweet, wealth, welfare, (be) well(-favoured)., 		כַּטּ֥וֹבkaṭ-ṭō-wḇ as seems good Prep-k, Art | Adj-ms

H5869 עַיִן ʻayin ah-yin probably a primitive word; an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape); affliction, outward appearance, phrase before, phrase think best, colour, conceit, phrase be content, countenance, phrase displease, eye((-brow), (-d), -sight), face, phrase favour, fountain, furrow (from the margin), idiom him, phrase humble, knowledge, look, (phrase well), idiom me, open(-ly), phrase (not) please, presence, phrase regard, resemblance, sight, idiom thee, idiom them, phrase think, idiom us, well, idiom you(-rselves). 		בְּעֵינֶֽיךָ׃bə-‘ê-ne-ḵā. to you Prep-b | N-cdc | 2ms
11 The king said to Haman, The silver is given to you, the people also, to do with them as it seems good to you.Esther 3:11
Stats
Counts: 119 characters, 22 words, 91 letters, 38 vowels, 53 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ לְהָמָ֔ן הַכֶּ֖סֶף נָת֣וּן לָ֑ךְ וְהָעָ֕ם לַעֲשֹׂ֥ות בֹּ֖ו כַּטֹּ֥וב בְּעֵינֶֽיךָ׃

Lit: And said the king to Haman the money are given to you and the people to do with them as seems good to you

KJV: And the king said unto Haman, The silver is given to thee, the people also, to do with them as it seemeth good to thee.
References

"to do"
Ps 73:7: Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.
Jer 26:14: As for me: look: I am in your hand: do with me as seems good and meet to you.
Jer 40:4: Now: look: I loose you this day from the chains which were upon your hand. If it seem good to you to come with me into Babylon: come; and I will look well to you: but if it seem ill to you to come with me into Babylon: forbear: look: all the land is before you: whither it seems good and convenient for you to go: there go.
Lu 23:25: He released to them Him that for sedition and murder was cast into prison: whom they had desired; but He delivered Jesus to their will.

 וַיִּקָּרְאוּ֩ סֹפְרֵ֨י הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָרִאשֹׁ֗ון בִּשְׁלֹושָׁ֨ה עָשָׂ֣ר יֹום֮ בֹּו֒ וַיִּכָּתֵ֣ב כְּֽכָל־אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֣ה הָמָ֡ן אֶ֣ל אֲחַשְׁדַּרְפְּנֵֽי־הַ֠מֶּלֶךְ וְֽאֶל־הַפַּחֹ֞ות אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ עַל־מְדִינָ֣ה וּמְדִינָ֗ה וְאֶל־שָׂ֤רֵי עַם֙ וָעָ֔ם מְדִינָ֤ה וּמְדִינָה֙ כִּכְתָבָ֔הּ וְעַ֥ם וָעָ֖ם כִּלְשֹׁונֹ֑ו בְּשֵׁ֨ם הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹשׁ֙ נִכְתָּ֔ב וְנֶחְתָּ֖ם בְּטַבַּ֥עַת הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃

H4428הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ham-me-leḵ.   (Art | N-ms)
H4428 מֶלֶךְ melek meh-lek from מָלַךְ; a king; king, royal. 		הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ham-me-leḵ. of the king Art | N-ms
12 Then were the king's scribes called on the thirteenth day of the first month, and there was written according to all that Haman had commanded to the king's lieutenants, and to the governors that were over every province, and to the rulers of every people of every province according to the writing thereof, and to every people after their language; in the name of king Ahasuerus was it written, and sealed with the king's ring.Esther 3:12
Stats
Rank: #9475 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 431 characters, 67 words, 345 letters, 127 vowels, 218 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיִּקָּרְאוּ֩ סֹפְרֵ֨י הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָרִאשֹׁ֗ון בִּשְׁלֹושָׁ֨ה עָשָׂ֣ר יֹום֮ בֹּו֒ וַיִּכָּתֵ֣ב כְּֽכָל־אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֣ה הָמָ֡ן אֶ֣ל אֲחַשְׁדַּרְפְּנֵֽי־הַ֠מֶּלֶךְ וְֽאֶל־הַפַּחֹ֞ות אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ עַל־מְדִינָ֣ה וּמְדִינָ֗ה וְאֶל־שָׂ֤רֵי עַם֙ וָעָ֔ם מְדִינָ֤ה וּמְדִינָה֙ כִּכְתָבָ֔הּ וְעַ֥ם וָעָ֖ם כִּלְשֹׁונֹ֑ו בְּשֵׁ֨ם הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹשׁ֙ נִכְתָּ֔ב וְנֶחְתָּ֖ם בְּטַבַּ֥עַת הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃

Lit: And were called scribes of the king of the month first on three and ten day in and a decree was written according to all that commanded Haman to satraps of the king and to the governors who were over that were over every province and each province and to the officials of and all people each and to every province according to its script and to every people in their language in the name of King Ahasuerus it was written and sealed with signet ring of the king

KJV: Then were the king's scribes called on the thirteenth day of the first month, and there was written according to all that Haman had commanded unto the king's lieutenants, and to the governors that were over every province, and to the rulers of every people of every province according to the writing thereof, and [to] every people after their language; in the name of king Ahasuerus was it written, and sealed with the king's ring.
References

"Then were"
Es 8:9-17: Then were the king's scribes called at that time in the third month: that is: the month Sivan: on the 3 and twentieth day thereof; and it was written according to all that Mordecai commanded to the Jews: and to the lieutenants: and the deputies and rulers of the provinces which are from India to Ethiopia: 127 provinces: to every province according to the writing thereof: and to every people after their language: and to the Jews according to their writing: and according to their language.

"according"
Es 1:22: For he sent letters into all the king's provinces: into every province according to the writing thereof: and to every people after their language: that every man should bear rule in his own house: and that it should be published according to the language of every people.
Es 8:9: Then were the king's scribes called at that time in the third month: that is: the month Sivan: on the 3 and twentieth day thereof; and it was written according to all that Mordecai commanded to the Jews: and to the lieutenants: and the deputies and rulers of the provinces which are from India to Ethiopia: 127 provinces: to every province according to the writing thereof: and to every people after their language: and to the Jews according to their writing: and according to their language.
Es 9:27: The Jews ordained: and took upon them: and upon their seed: and upon all such as joined themselves to them: so as it not should fail: that they would keep these two days according to their writing: and according to their appointed time every year;

"in the name"
1Ki 21:8: So she wrote letters in Ahab's name: and sealed them with his seal: and sent the letters to the elders and to the nobles that were in his city: dwelling with Naboth.
Da 6:8: 12: 15: Now: O king: establish the decree: and sign the writing: that it not be changed: according to the law of the Medes and Persians: which alters not.

"sealed"
Es 8:2: 8: 10: The king took off his ring: which he had taken from Haman: and gave it to Mordecai. And Esther set Mordecai over the house of Haman.

 וְנִשְׁלֹ֨וחַ סְפָרִ֜ים בְּיַ֣ד הָרָצִים֮ אֶל־כָּל־מְדִינֹ֣ות הַמֶּלֶךְ֒ לְהַשְׁמִ֡יד לַהֲרֹ֣ג וּלְאַבֵּ֣ד אֶת־כָּל־הַ֠יְּהוּדִים מִנַּ֨עַר וְעַד־זָקֵ֨ן טַ֤ף וְנָשִׁים֙ בְּיֹ֣ום אֶחָ֔ד בִּשְׁלֹושָׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֛ר לְחֹ֥דֶשׁ שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֖ר הוּא־חֹ֣דֶשׁ אֲדָ֑ר וּשְׁלָלָ֖ם לָבֹֽוז׃

13 The letters were sent by posts into all the king's provinces, to destroy, to kill, and to cause to perish, all Jews, both young and old, little children and women, in one day, even upon the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, which is the month Adar, and to take the spoil of them for a prey.Esther 3:13
Stats
Counts: 303 characters, 42 words, 228 letters, 78 vowels, 150 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְנִשְׁלֹ֨וחַ סְפָרִ֜ים בְּיַ֣ד הָרָצִים֮ אֶל־כָּל־מְדִינֹ֣ות הַמֶּלֶךְ֒ לְהַשְׁמִ֡יד לַהֲרֹ֣ג וּלְאַבֵּ֣ד אֶת־כָּל־הַ֠יְּהוּדִים מִנַּ֨עַר וְעַד־זָקֵ֨ן טַ֤ף וְנָשִׁים֙ בְּיֹ֣ום אֶחָ֔ד בִּשְׁלֹושָׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֛ר לְחֹ֥דֶשׁ שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֖ר הוּא־חֹ֣דֶשׁ אֲדָ֑ר וּשְׁלָלָ֖ם לָבֹֽוז׃

Lit: And were sent the letters by couriers into all provinces of the king to destroy to kill and to annihilate all the Jews from young and to old little children and women in day one on three and ten day of the two and ten [month] that is the month of Adar and to plunder their possessions

KJV: And the letters were sent by posts into all the king's provinces, to destroy, to kill, and to cause to perish, all Jews, both young and old, little children and women, in one day, even upon the thirteenth [day] of the twelfth month, which [is] the month Adar, and [to take] the spoil of them for a prey.
References

"by posts"
Es 8:10: 14: He wrote in the king Ahasuerus' name: and sealed it with the king's ring: and sent letters by posts on horseback: and riders on mules: camels: and young dromedaries:
2Ch 30:6: So the posts went with the letters from the king and His princes throughout all Israel and Judah: and according to the commandment of the king: saying: You children of Israel: turn again to the LORD God of Abraham: Isaac: and Israel: and He will return to the remnant of you: that are escaped out of the hand of the kings of Assyria.
Job 9:25: Now my days are swifter than a post: they flee away: they see no good.
Jer 51:31: one post will run to meet another: and one messenger to meet another: to show the king of Babylon that his city is taken at one end:
Ro 3:15: Their feet are swift to shed blood:

"both young"
1Sa 15:3: Now go and smite Amalek: and utterly destroy all that they have: and spare not them; but kill both man and woman: infant and suckling: ox and sheep: camel and ass.
1Sa 22:19: Nob: the city of the priests: smote he with the edge of the sword: both men and women: children and sucklings: and oxen: and asses: and sheep: with the edge of the sword.

"in one day"
Es 8:12-14: Upon one day in all the provinces of king Ahasuerus: namely: upon the thirteenth day of the twelfth month: which is the month Adar.
Jas 2:13: For he will have judgment without mercy: that has showed no mercy; and mercy rejoices against judgment.

"the spoil"
Es 8:11: Wherein the king granted the Jews which were in every city to gather themselves together: and to stand for their life: to destroy: to kill: and to cause to perish: all the power of the people and province that would assault them: both little ones and women: and to take the spoil of them for a prey:
Es 9:10: The 10 sons of Haman the son of Hammedatha: the enemy of the Jews: killed they; but on the spoil laid not they their hand.
Isa 10:6: I will send him against an hypocritical nation: and against the people of my wrath will I give him a charge: to take the spoil: and to take the prey: and to tread them down like the mire of the streets.

14 The copy of the writing for a commandment to be given in every province was published to all people, that they should be ready against that day.Esther 3:14
Stats
Counts: 146 characters, 26 words, 118 letters, 43 vowels, 75 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: פַּתְשֶׁ֣גֶן הַכְּתָ֗ב לְהִנָּ֤תֵֽן דָּת֙ בְּכָל־מְדִינָ֣ה וּמְדִינָ֔ה גָּל֖וּי לְכָל־הָֽעַמִּ֑ים לִהְיֹ֥ות עֲתִדִ֖ים לַיֹּ֥ום הַזֶּֽה׃

Lit: A copy of the document was to be issued as law in every province and province being published for all people that they should be ready for day this

KJV: The copy of the writing for a commandment to be given in every province was published unto all people, that they should be ready against that day.

15 The posts went out, being hastened by the king's commandment, and the decree was given in Shushan the palace. And the king and Haman sat down to drink; but the city Shushan was perplexed.Esther 3:15
Stats
Rank: #6841 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 187 characters, 30 words, 148 letters, 49 vowels, 99 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הָֽרָצִ֞ים יָצְא֤וּ דְחוּפִים֙ בִּדְבַ֣ר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְהַדָּ֥ת נִתְּנָ֖ה בְּשׁוּשַׁ֣ן הַבִּירָ֑ה וְהַמֶּ֤לֶךְ וְהָמָן֙ יָשְׁב֣וּ לִשְׁתֹּ֔ות וְהָעִ֥יר שׁוּשָׁ֖ן נָבֹֽוכָה׃ פ

Lit: The couriers went out hastened by command of the king and the decree was proclaimed in Shushan the citadel So the king and Haman sat down to drink but the city of Shushan was perplexed

KJV: The posts went out, being hastened by the king's commandment, and the decree was given in Shushan the palace. And the king and Haman sat down to drink; but the city Shushan was perplexed.
References

"hastened"
Pr 1:16: For their feet run to evil: and make haste to shed blood.
Pr 4:16: For they not sleep: except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away: unless they cause some to fall.

"sat down"
Ho 7:5: In the day of our king the princes have made him sick with bottles of wine; he stretched out his hand with scorners.
Am 6:6: That drink wine in bowls: and anoint themselves with the chief ointments: but they not are grieved for the affliction of Joseph.
Joh 16:20: Truly: truly: I say to you: That you will weep and lament: but the world will rejoice: and you will be sorrowful: but your sorrow will be turned into joy.
Re 11:10: They that dwell upon the earth will rejoice over them: and make merry: and will send gifts one to another; because these two prophets tormented them that dwelt on the earth.

"the city"
Es 4:16: Go: gather together all the Jews that are present in Shushan: and fast you for me: and neither eat nor drink 3 days: night or day: I also and my maidens will fast likewise; and so will I go in to the king: which is not according to the law: and if I perish: I perish.
Es 8:15: Mordecai went out from the presence of the king in royal apparel of blue and white: and with a great crown of gold: and with a garment of fine linen and purple: and the city of Shushan rejoiced and was glad.
Pr 29:2: When the righteous are in authority: the people rejoice: but when the wicked bears rule: the people mourn.

4
Mordecai Appeals to Esther

The Jews Lament Over the Royal Edict

H3045יָדַע֙yā-ḏa‘   (V-Qal-Perf-3ms)
H3045 יָדַע yâdaʻ yaw-dah a primitive root; to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.); acknowledge, acquaintance(-ted with), advise, answer, appoint, assuredly, be aware, (un-) awares, can(-not), certainly, comprehend, consider, idiom could they, cunning, declare, be diligent, (can, cause to) discern, discover, endued with, familiar friend, famous, feel, can have, be (ig-) norant, instruct, kinsfolk, kinsman, (cause to let, make) know, (come to give, have, take) knowledge, have (knowledge), (be, make, make to be, make self) known, phrase be learned, phrase lie by man, mark, perceive, privy to, idiom prognosticator, regard, have respect, skilful, shew, can (man of) skill, be sure, of a surety, teach, (can) tell, understand, have (understanding), idiom will be, wist, wit, wot. 		יָדַע֙yā-ḏa‘ learned V-Qal-Perf-3ms
H3605כָּל־kāl-   (N-msc)
H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		כָּל־kāl- all N-msc
H834אֲשֶׁ֣ר’ă-šer   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection., 		אֲשֶׁ֣ר’ă-šer that Pro-r

H8242שַׂ֖קśaq   (N-ms)
H8242 שַׂק saq sak from שָׁקַק; properly, a mesh (as allowing a liquid to run through), i.e. coarse loose cloth or sacking (used in mourning and for bagging); hence, a bag (for grain, etc.); sack(-cloth, -clothes). 		שַׂ֖קśaq sackcloth N-ms

1 When Mordecai perceived all that was done, Mordecai tear his clothes, and put on sackcloth with ashes, and went out into the middle of the city, and cried with a loud and a bitter cry;Esther 4:1
Stats
Rank: #8870 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 183 characters, 31 words, 144 letters, 52 vowels, 92 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּמָרְדֳּכַ֗י יָדַע֙ אֶת־כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר נַעֲשָׂ֔ה וַיִּקְרַ֤ע מָרְדֳּכַי֙ אֶת־בְּגָדָ֔יו וַיִּלְבַּ֥שׁ שַׂ֖ק וָאֵ֑פֶר וַיֵּצֵא֙ בְּתֹ֣וךְ הָעִ֔יר וַיִּזְעַ֛ק זְעָקָ֥ה גְדֹלָ֖ה וּמָרָֽה׃

Lit: And when Mordecai learned all that had happened and tore Mordecai his clothes and put on sackcloth and ashes and went out into the midst of the city and He cried out with cry a loud and bitter

KJV: When Mordecai perceived all that was done, Mordecai rent his clothes, and put on sackcloth with ashes, and went out into the midst of the city, and cried with a loud and a bitter cry;
References

"all that"
Es 3:8-13: Haman said to king Ahasuerus: There is a certain people scattered abroad and dispersed among the people in all the provinces of your kingdom; and their laws are diverse from all people; neither keep they the king's laws: therefore it is not for the king's profit to suffer them.

"rent"
2Sa 1:11: Then David took hold on his clothes: and tear them; and likewise all the men that were with him:
Job 1:20: Then Job arose: and tear his mantle: and shaved his head: and fell down upon the ground: and worshipped:
Jon 3:4-9: Jonah began to enter into the city a day's journey: and he cried: and said: Yet 40 days: and Nineveh will be overthrown.
Ac 14:14: Which when the apostles: Barnabas and Paul: heard of: they tear their clothes: and ran in among the people: crying out:

"with ashes"
Es 4:3: In every province: wherever the king's commandment and his decree came: there was great mourning among the Jews: and fasting: and weeping: and wailing; and many lay in sackcloth and ashes.
Jos 7:6: Joshua tear His clothes: and fell to the earth upon His face before the ark of the LORD until the eventide: He and the elders of Israel: and put dust upon their heads.
2Sa 13:19: Tamar put ashes on her head: and tear her garment of divers colours that was on her: and laid her hand on her head: and went on crying.
Job 2:8: He took him a potsherd to scrape himself withal; and he sat down among the ashes.
Job 42:6: For what reason I abhor myself: and repent in dust and ashes.
Isa 58:5: Is it such a fast that I have chosen? a day for a man to afflict His soul? is it to bow down His head as a bulrush: and to spread sackcloth and ashes under Him? will you call this a fast: and an acceptable day to the LORD?
Eze 27:30: will cause their voice to be heard against you: and will cry bitterly: and will cast up dust upon their heads: they will wallow themselves in the ashes:
Da 9:3: I set my face to the Lord God: to seek by prayer and supplications: with fasting: and sackcloth: and ashes:
Jon 3:6: For word came to the king of Nineveh: and he arose from his throne: and he laid his robe from him: and covered him with sackcloth: and sat in ashes.
Mt 11:21: Woe to you: Chorazin! woe to you: Bethsaida! for if the mighty works: which were done in you: had been done in Tyre and Sidon: they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.

"and cried"
Ge 27:34: When Esau heard the words of his father: he cried with a great and exceeding bitter cry: and said to his father: Bless me: even me also: O my father.
Isa 15:4: Heshbon will cry: and Elealeh: their voice will be heard even to Jahaz: therefore the armed soldiers of Moab will cry out; his life will be grievous to him.
Isa 22:4: Therefore said I: Look away from me; I will weep bitterly: not labour to comfort me: because of the spoiling of the daughter of my people.
Eze 21:6: Sigh therefore: you son of man: with the breaking of your loins; and with bitterness sigh before their eyes.
Eze 27:31: They will make themselves utterly bald for you: and gird them with sackcloth: and they will weep for you with bitterness of heart and bitter wailing.
Mic 1:8: Therefore I will wail and howl: I will go stripped and naked: I will make a wailing like the dragons: and mourning as the owls.
Zep 1:14: The great day of the LORD is near: it is near: and hasts greatly: even the voice of the day of the LORD: the mighty man will cry there bitterly.
Re 18:17-19: For in one hour so great riches is come to nought. And every shipmaster: and all the company in ships: and sailors: and as many as trade by sea: stood afar off:

וַיָּבֹ֕וא עַ֖ד לִפְנֵ֣י שַֽׁעַר־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין לָבֹ֛וא אֶל־שַׁ֥עַר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ בִּלְב֥וּשׁ שָֽׂק׃

2 Came even before the king's gate: for none might enter into the king's gate clothed with sackcloth.Esther 4:2
Stats
Counts: 103 characters, 17 words, 82 letters, 29 vowels, 53 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֕וא עַ֖ד לִפְנֵ֣י שַֽׁעַר־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין לָבֹ֛וא אֶל־שַׁ֥עַר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ בִּלְב֥וּשׁ שָֽׂק׃

Lit: And He went even as far as the front of gate of the king for no one might enter into gate of the king clothed with sackcloth

KJV: And came even before the king's gate: for none might enter into the king's gate clothed with sackcloth.

 וּבְכָל־מְדִינָ֣ה וּמְדִינָ֗ה מְקֹום֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר דְּבַר־הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ וְדָתֹו֙ מַגִּ֔יעַ אֵ֤בֶל גָּדֹול֙ לַיְּהוּדִ֔ים וְצֹ֥ום וּבְכִ֖י וּמִסְפֵּ֑ד שַׂ֣ק וָאֵ֔פֶר יֻצַּ֖ע לָֽרַבִּֽים׃

H3605וּבְכָל־ū-ḇə-ḵāl   (Conj-w, Prep-b | N-msc)
H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		וּבְכָל־ū-ḇə-ḵāl And in every Conj-w, Prep-b | N-msc

H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). 3 In every province, wherever the king's commandment and his decree came, there was great mourning among the Jews, and fasting, and weeping, and wailing; and many lay in sackcloth and ashes.Esther 4:3
Stats
Counts: 197 characters, 26 words, 158 letters, 56 vowels, 102 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּבְכָל־מְדִינָ֣ה וּמְדִינָ֗ה מְקֹום֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר דְּבַר־הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ וְדָתֹו֙ מַגִּ֔יעַ אֵ֤בֶל גָּדֹול֙ לַיְּהוּדִ֔ים וְצֹ֥ום וּבְכִ֖י וּמִסְפֵּ֑ד שַׂ֣ק וָאֵ֔פֶר יֻצַּ֖ע לָֽרַבִּֽים׃

Lit: And in every province and province wherever where command of the king and decree arrived there was mourning great among the Jews and with fasting and weeping and wailing in sackcloth and ashes lay many

KJV: And in every province, whithersoever the king's commandment and his decree came, there was great mourning among the Jews, and fasting, and weeping, and wailing; and many lay in sackcloth and ashes.
References

"in every province"
Es 1:1: Now it came to pass in the days of Ahasuerus: (this is Ahasuerus which reigned: from India even to Ethiopia: over 107 and 20 provinces:)
Es 3:12: Then were the king's scribes called on the thirteenth day of the first month: and there was written according to all that Haman had commanded to the king's lieutenants: and to the governors that were over every province: and to the rulers of every people of every province according to the writing thereof: and to every people after their language; in the name of king Ahasuerus was it written: and sealed with the king's ring.

"great mourning"
1Sa 4:13: 14: When He came: indeed: Eli sat upon a seat by the wayside watching: for His heart trembled for the ark of God. And when the man came into the city: and told it: all the city cried out.
1Sa 11:4: Then came the messengers to Gibeah of Saul: and told the tidings in the ears of the people: and all the people lifted up their voices: and wept.
Isa 22:4: 12: Therefore said I: Look away from me; I will weep bitterly: not labour to comfort me: because of the spoiling of the daughter of my people.
Isa 37:1-3: It came to pass: when king Hezekiah heard it: that He tear His clothes: and covered Himself with sackcloth: and went into the house of the LORD.

"weeping"
Mt 13:42: will cast them into a furnace of fire: there will be wailing and gnashing of teeth.
Mt 22:13: Then said the king to the servants: Bind him hand and foot: and take him away: and cast him into outer darkness; there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
Mt 25:30: Cast you the unprofitable servant into outer darkness: there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

"many lay in sackcloth and ashes"
Isa 58:5: Is it such a fast that I have chosen? a day for a man to afflict His soul? is it to bow down His head as a bulrush: and to spread sackcloth and ashes under Him? will you call this a fast: and an acceptable day to the LORD?
Da 9:3: I set my face to the Lord God: to seek by prayer and supplications: with fasting: and sackcloth: and ashes:

Mordecai Persuades Esther to Appeal to the King

[וַתְּבֹואֶינָה כ] (וַ֠תָּבֹואנָה ק) נַעֲרֹ֨ות אֶסְתֵּ֤ר וְסָרִיסֶ֙יהָ֙ וַיַּגִּ֣ידוּ לָ֔הּ וַתִּתְחַלְחַ֥ל הַמַּלְכָּ֖ה מְאֹ֑ד וַתִּשְׁלַ֨ח בְּגָדִ֜ים לְהַלְבִּ֣ישׁ אֶֽת־מָרְדֳּכַ֗י וּלְהָסִ֥יר שַׂקֹּ֛ו מֵעָלָ֖יו וְלֹ֥א קִבֵּֽל׃

4 So Esther's maids and her chamberlains came and told it her. Then was the queen exceedingly grieved; and she sent clothing to clothe Mordecai, and to take away his sackcloth from him: but he received it not.Esther 4:4
Stats
Counts: 208 characters, 31 words, 164 letters, 62 vowels, 102 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: [וַתְּבֹואֶינָה כ] (וַ֠תָּבֹואנָה ק) נַעֲרֹ֨ות אֶסְתֵּ֤ר וְסָרִיסֶ֙יהָ֙ וַיַּגִּ֣ידוּ לָ֔הּ וַתִּתְחַלְחַ֥ל הַמַּלְכָּ֖ה מְאֹ֑ד וַתִּשְׁלַ֨ח בְּגָדִ֜ים לְהַלְבִּ֣ישׁ אֶֽת־מָרְדֳּכַ֗י וּלְהָסִ֥יר שַׂקֹּ֛ו מֵעָלָ֖יו וְלֹ֥א קִבֵּֽל׃

Lit: So came maids of Esther and eunuchs and told her and was distressed the queen deeply and she sent garments to clothe Mordecai and take away his sackcloth from him but not he would accept them

KJV: So Esther's maids and her chamberlains came and told it her. Then was the queen exceedingly grieved; and she sent raiment to clothe Mordecai, and to take away his sackcloth from him: but he received [it] not.
References

"chamberlains"
Es 1:12: But the queen Vashti refused to come at the king's commandment by his chamberlains: therefore was the king very angry: and his anger burned in him.
1Sa 8:15: He will take the tenth of your seed: and of your vineyards: and give to his officers: and to his servants.
2Ki 9:32: He lifted up his face to the window: and said: Who is on my side? who? And there looked out to him two or 3 eunuchs.
Isa 56:3: Neither let the son of the stranger: that has joined Himself to the LORD: speak: saying: The LORD has utterly separated me from His people: neither let the eunuch say: Look: I am a dry tree.
Ac 8:27: He arose and went: and: look: a man of Ethiopia: an eunuch of great authority under Candace queen of the Ethiopians: who had the charge of all her treasure: and had come to Jerusalem for to worship:

"but he received it not"
Ge 37:35: All his sons and all his daughters rose up to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted; and he said: For I will go down into the grave to my son mourning. Thus his father wept for him.
Ps 77:2: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran in the night: and not ceased: my soul refused to be comforted.
Jer 31:15: Thus says the LORD; A voice was heard in Ramah: lamentation: and bitter weeping; Rahel weeping for her children refused to be comforted for her children: because they were not.

 וַתִּקְרָא֩ אֶסְתֵּ֨ר לַהֲתָ֜ךְ מִסָּרִיסֵ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֶעֱמִ֣יד לְפָנֶ֔יהָ וַתְּצַוֵּ֖הוּ עַֽל־מָרְדֳּכָ֑י לָדַ֥עַת מַה־זֶּ֖ה וְעַל־מַה־זֶּֽה׃

H5631 סָרִיס çârîyç saw-reece or סָרִס; from an unused root meaning to castrate; a eunuch; by implication, valet (especially of the female apartments), and thus, a minister of state; chamberlain, eunuch, officer. Compare רַב־סָרִיס. 		מִסָּרִיסֵ֤יmis-sā-rî-sê one of eunuchs Prep-m | N-mpc

H4100 מָה mâh maw or מַה; or מָ; or מַ; also מֶה; a primitive particle; properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! 5 Then called Esther for Hatach, one of the king's chamberlains, whom he had appointed to attend upon her, and gave him a commandment to Mordecai, to know what it was, and why it was.Esther 4:5
Stats
Rank: #4040 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 185 characters, 27 words, 141 letters, 51 vowels, 90 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַתִּקְרָא֩ אֶסְתֵּ֨ר לַהֲתָ֜ךְ מִסָּרִיסֵ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֶעֱמִ֣יד לְפָנֶ֔יהָ וַתְּצַוֵּ֖הוּ עַֽל־מָרְדֳּכָ֑י לָדַ֥עַת מַה־זֶּ֖ה וְעַל־מַה־זֶּֽה׃

Lit: And called Esther Hathach one of eunuchs of the king whom he had appointed to attend her and she gave him a command concerning Mordecai to learn what is this and why and why this was

KJV: Then called Esther for Hatach, one of the king's chamberlains, whom he had appointed to attend upon her, and gave him a commandment to Mordecai, to know what it [was], and why it [was].
References

"appointed to attend upon her"
Es 1:10: 12: On the seventh day: when the heart of the king was merry with wine: he commanded Mehuman: Biztha: Harbona: Bigtha: and Abagtha: Zethar: and Carcas: the 7 chamberlains that served in the presence of Ahasuerus the king:

"to know"
Ro 12:15: Rejoice with them that do rejoice: and weep with them that weep.
1Co 12:26: Whether one member suffer: all the members suffer with it; or one member be honoured: all the members rejoice with it.
Php 2:4: not Look every man on his own things: but every man also on the things of others.
Heb 4:15: For we not have an high priest which cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities; but was in all points tempted like as we are: yet without sin.
