H5921עַל־‘al-   (Prep)
H5921 עַל ʻal al properly, the same as עַל used as a preposition (in the singular or plural often with prefix, or as conjunction with a particle following); above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications; above, according to(-ly), after, (as) against, among, and, idiom as, at, because of, beside (the rest of), between, beyond the time, idiom both and, by (reason of), idiom had the charge of, concerning for, in (that), (forth, out) of, (from) (off), (up-) on, over, than, through(-out), to, touching, idiom with., 		עַל־‘al- on Prep
H6086הָעֵ֖ץhā-‘êṣ   (Art | N-ms)
H6086 עֵץ ʻêts ates from עָצָה; a tree (from its firmness); hence, wood (plural sticks); phrase carpenter, gallows, helve, phrase pine, plank, staff, stalk, stick, stock, timber, tree, wood. 		הָעֵ֖ץhā-‘êṣ the gallows Art | N-ms
H834אֲשֶׁר־’ă-šer-   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection., 		אֲשֶׁר־’ă-šer- that Pro-r
H3559הֵכִ֥יןhê-ḵîn   (V-Hifil-Perf-3ms)
H3559 כּוּן kûwn koon a primitive root; properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous); certain(-ty), confirm, direct, faithfulness, fashion, fasten, firm, be fitted, be fixed, frame, be meet, ordain, order, perfect, (make) preparation, prepare (self), provide, make provision, (be, make) ready, right, set (aright, fast, forth), be stable, (e-) stablish, stand, tarry, idiom very deed. 		הֵכִ֥יןhê-ḵîn he had prepared V-Hifil-Perf-3ms
Hלֽוֹ׃lōw.   (Prep | 3ms)
 		לֽוֹ׃lōw. for him Prep | 3ms
4 The king said, Who is in the court? Now Haman was come into the outward court of the king's house, to speak to the king to hang Mordecai on the gallows that he had prepared for him.Esther 6:4
Stats
Counts: 187 characters, 35 words, 145 letters, 56 vowels, 89 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ מִ֣י בֶחָצֵ֑ר וְהָמָ֣ן בָּ֗א לַחֲצַ֤ר בֵּית־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ הַחִ֣יצֹונָ֔ה לֵאמֹ֣ר לַמֶּ֔לֶךְ לִתְלֹות֙ אֶֽת־מָרְדֳּכַ֔י עַל־הָעֵ֖ץ אֲשֶׁר־הֵכִ֥ין לֹֽו׃

Lit: So said the king who is in the court now Haman had just entered court of palace of the king the outer to suggest that the king hang Mordecai on the gallows that he had prepared for him

KJV: And the king said, Who is in the court? Now Haman was come into the outward court of the king's house, to speak unto the king to hang Mordecai on the gallows that he had prepared for him.
References

"Who is in the court"
Pr 3:27: 28: not Withhold good from them to whom it is due: when it is in the power of your hand to do it.
Ec 9:10: Whatever your hand finds to do: do it with your might; for there is no work: nor device: nor knowledge: nor wisdom: in the grave: whither you go.

"the outward"
Es 4:11: All the king's servants: and the people of the king's provinces: do know: that whoever: whether man or woman: will come to the king into the inner court: who not is called: there is one law of his to put him to death: except such to whom the king will hold out the golden sceptre: that he may live: but I not have been called to come in to the king these 30 days.
Es 5:1: Now it came to pass on the third day: that Esther put on her royal apparel: and stood in the inner court of the king's house: over against the king's house: and the king sat upon his royal throne in the royal house: over against the gate of the house.

"to speak"
Es 3:8-11: Haman said to king Ahasuerus: There is a certain people scattered abroad and dispersed among the people in all the provinces of your kingdom; and their laws are diverse from all people; neither keep they the king's laws: therefore it is not for the king's profit to suffer them.
Es 5:14: Then said Zeresh his wife and all his friends to him: Let a gallows be made of 50 cubits high: and to morrow speak you to the king that Mordecai may be hanged thereon: then go you in merrily with the king to the banquet. And the thing pleased Haman; and he caused the gallows to be made.
Es 7:9: Harbonah: one of the chamberlains: said before the king: Look also: the gallows 50 cubits high: which Haman had made for Mordecai: who had spoken good for the king: stands in the house of Haman. Then the king said: Hang him thereon.
Job 5:13: He takes the wise in their own craftiness: and the counsel of the froward is carried headlong.
Ps 2:4: He who sits in the heavens will laugh: the Lord will have them in derision.
Ps 33:19: To deliver their soul from death: and to keep them alive in famine.

 וַיֹּ֨אמְר֜וּ נַעֲרֵ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֵלָ֔יו הִנֵּ֥ה הָמָ֖ן עֹמֵ֣ד בֶּחָצֵ֑ר וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ יָבֹֽוא׃

5 The king's servants said to him, Look, Haman stands in the court. And the king said, Let him come in.Esther 6:5
Stats
Counts: 111 characters, 17 words, 85 letters, 30 vowels, 55 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמְר֜וּ נַעֲרֵ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֵלָ֔יו הִנֵּ֥ה הָמָ֖ן עֹמֵ֣ד בֶּחָצֵ֑ר וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ יָבֹֽוא׃

Lit: And said servants of the king to him is there Haman standing in the court And said the king let him come in

KJV: And the king's servants said unto him, Behold, Haman standeth in the court. And the king said, Let him come in.

H4100מַה־mah-   (Interrog)
H4100 מָה mâh maw or מַה; or מָ; or מַ; also מֶה; a primitive particle; properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses; how (long, oft, (-soever)), (no-) thing, what (end, good, purpose, thing), whereby(-fore, -in, -to, -with), (for) why., 		מַה־mah- what Interrog

H376בָּאִ֕ישׁbā-’îš   (Prep-b, Art | N-ms)
H376 אִישׁ ʼîysh eesh contracted for אֱנוֹשׁ (or perhaps rather from an unused root meaning to be extant); a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation); also, another, any (man), a certain, phrase champion, consent, each, every (one), fellow, (foot-, husband-) man, (good-, great, mighty) man, he, high (degree), him (that is), husband, man(-kind), phrase none, one, people, person, phrase steward, what (man) soever, whoso(-ever), worthy. Compare אִשָּׁה. 		בָּאִ֕ישׁbā-’îš for the man Prep-b, Art | N-ms
H834אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). 6 So Haman came in. And the king said to him, What will be done to the man whom the king delights to honour? Now Haman thought in his heart, To whom would the king delight to do honour more than to myself?Esther 6:6
Stats
Counts: 210 characters, 38 words, 164 letters, 60 vowels, 104 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיָּבֹוא֮ הָמָן֒ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לֹו֙ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ מַה־לַעֲשֹׂ֕ות בָּאִ֕ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ חָפֵ֣ץ בִּיקָרֹ֑ו וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הָמָן֙ בְּלִבֹּ֔ו לְמִ֞י יַחְפֹּ֥ץ הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ לַעֲשֹׂ֥ות יְקָ֖ר יֹותֵ֥ר מִמֶּֽנִּי׃

Lit: So came in Haman and asked him the king what shall be done for the man whom the king delights to honor and thought Haman in his heart Whom would delight the king to honor more than me

KJV: So Haman came in. And the king said unto him, What shall be done unto the man whom the king delighteth to honour? Now Haman thought in his heart, To whom would the king delight to do honour more than to myself?

"whom the king, etc"

Isa 42:1: Look my servant: whom I uphold; my elect: in whom my soul delights; I have put my spirit upon him: he will bring forth judgment to the Gentiles.
Isa 62:4: 5: You will no more be termed Forsaken; neither will your land any more be termed Desolate: but you will be called Hephzibah: and your land Beulah: for the LORD delights in you: and your land will be married.
Jer 32:41: Yes: I will rejoice over them to do them good: and I will plant them in this land assuredly with my whole heart and with my whole soul.
Mt 3:17: indeed a voice from heaven: saying: This is my beloved Son: in whom I am well pleased.
Joh 5:23: That all men should honour the Son: even as they honour the Father. He who honours'>honours not the Son honours'>honours not the Father which has sent Him.

8 Let the royal apparel be brought which the king useth to wear, and the horse that the king rids upon, and the crown royal which is set upon his head:Esther 6:8
Stats
Rank: #8120 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 151 characters, 28 words, 119 letters, 42 vowels, 77 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יָבִ֙יאוּ֙ לְב֣וּשׁ מַלְכ֔וּת אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָֽבַשׁ־בֹּ֖ו הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וְס֗וּס אֲשֶׁ֨ר רָכַ֤ב עָלָיו֙ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר נִתַּ֛ן כֶּ֥תֶר מַלְכ֖וּת בְּרֹאשֹֽׁו׃

Lit: let be brought robe a royal which has worn in the king and a horse on which has ridden on the king and which has placed crest a royal on its head

KJV: Let the royal apparel be brought which the king useth to wear, and the horse that the king rideth upon, and the crown royal which is set upon his head:

 וְנָתֹ֨ון הַלְּב֜וּשׁ וְהַסּ֗וּס עַל־יַד־אִ֞ישׁ מִשָּׂרֵ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ הַֽפַּרְתְּמִ֔ים וְהִלְבִּ֙ישׁוּ֙ אֶת־הָאִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ חָפֵ֣ץ בִּֽיקָרֹ֑ו וְהִרְכִּיבֻ֤הוּ עַל־הַסּוּס֙ בִּרְחֹ֣וב הָעִ֔יר וְקָרְא֣וּ לְפָנָ֔יו כָּ֚כָה יֵעָשֶׂ֣ה לָאִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ חָפֵ֥ץ בִּיקָרֹֽו׃

H5414וְנָת֨וֹןwə-nā-ṯō-wn   (Conj-w | V-Qal-InfAbs)
H5414 נָתַן nâthan naw-than a primitive root; to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.); add, apply, appoint, ascribe, assign, idiom avenge, idiom be (healed), bestow, bring (forth, hither), cast, cause, charge, come, commit, consider, count, phrase cry, deliver (up), direct, distribute, do, idiom doubtless, idiom without fail, fasten, frame, idiom get, give (forth, over, up), grant, hang (up), idiom have, idiom indeed, lay (unto charge, up), (give) leave, lend, let (out), phrase lie, lift up, make, phrase O that, occupy, offer, ordain, pay, perform, place, pour, print, idiom pull, put (forth), recompense, render, requite, restore, send (out), set (forth), shew, shoot forth (up), phrase sing, phrase slander, strike, (sub-) mit, suffer, idiom surely, idiom take, thrust, trade, turn, utter, phrase weep, phrase willingly, phrase withdraw, phrase would (to) God, yield. 		וְנָת֨וֹןwə-nā-ṯō-wn and let be delivered Conj-w | V-Qal-InfAbs

H3830 לְבוּשׁ lᵉbûwsh leb-oosh or לְבֻשׁ; from לָבַשׁ; a garment (literally or figuratively); by implication (euphemistically) a wife; apparel, clothed with, clothing, garment, raiment, vestment, vesture. 		הַלְּב֜וּשׁhal-lə-ḇūš the robe Art | N-ms
H5483וְהַסּ֗וּסwə-has-sūs,   (Conj-w, Art | N-ms)
H5483 סוּס çûwç soos or סֻס; from an unused root meaning to skip (properly, for joy); a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight); crane, horse (-back, -hoof). Compare פָּרָשׁ. 		וְהַסּ֗וּסwə-has-sūs, and horse Conj-w, Art | N-ms
H5921עַל־‘al-   (Prep)
H5921 עַל ʻal al properly, the same as עַל used as a preposition (in the singular or plural often with prefix, or as conjunction with a particle following); above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications; above, according to(-ly), after, (as) against, among, and, idiom as, at, because of, beside (the rest of), between, beyond the time, idiom both and, by (reason of), idiom had the charge of, concerning for, in (that), (forth, out) of, (from) (off), (up-) on, over, than, through(-out), to, touching, idiom with., 		עַל־‘al- to Prep
H3027יַד־yaḏ-   (N-fsc)
H3027 יָד yâd yawd a primitive word; in distinction from כַּף, the closed one); used (as noun, adverb, etc.) in a great variety of applications, both literally and figuratively, both proximate and remote (as follows); a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),; (phrase be) able, idiom about, phrase armholes, at, axletree, because of, beside, border, idiom bounty, phrase broad, (broken-) handed, idiom by, charge, coast, phrase consecrate, phrase creditor, custody, debt, dominion, idiom enough, phrase fellowship, force, idiom from, hand(-staves, -y work), idiom he, himself, idiom in, labour, phrase large, ledge, (left-) handed, means, idiom mine, ministry, near, idiom of, idiom order, ordinance, idiom our, parts, pain, power, idiom presumptuously, service, side, sore, state, stay, draw with strength, stroke, phrase swear, terror, idiom thee, idiom by them, idiom themselves, idiom thine own, idiom thou, through, idiom throwing, phrase thumb, times, idiom to, idiom under, idiom us, idiom wait on, (way-) side, where, phrase wide, idiom with (him, me, you), work, phrase yield, idiom yourselves. 		יַד־yaḏ- the hand N-fsc
H376אִ֞ישׁ’îš   (N-ms)
H376 אִישׁ ʼîysh eesh contracted for אֱנוֹשׁ (or perhaps rather from an unused root meaning to be extant); a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation); also, another, any (man), a certain, phrase champion, consent, each, every (one), fellow, (foot-, husband-) man, (good-, great, mighty) man, he, high (degree), him (that is), husband, man(-kind), phrase none, one, people, person, phrase steward, what (man) soever, whoso(-ever), worthy. Compare אִשָּׁה. 		אִ֞ישׁ’îš of one N-ms

H834אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection., 		אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer whom Pro-r

H3366בִּיקָרֽוֹ׃bî-qā-rōw.   (Prep-b | N-msc | 3ms)
H3366 יְקָר yᵉqâr yek-awr from יָקַר; value, i.e. (concretely) wealth; abstractly, costliness, dignity; honour, precious (things), price. 		בִּיקָרֽוֹ׃bî-qā-rōw. to honor Prep-b | N-msc | 3ms
9 Let this apparel and horse be delivered to the hand of one of the king's most noble princes, that they may array the man withal whom the king delights'>delights to honour, and bring him on horseback through the street of the city, and proclaim before him, Thus will it be done to the man whom the king delights'>delights to honour.Esther 6:9
Stats
Counts: 320 characters, 57 words, 254 letters, 89 vowels, 165 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְנָתֹ֨ון הַלְּב֜וּשׁ וְהַסּ֗וּס עַל־יַד־אִ֞ישׁ מִשָּׂרֵ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ הַֽפַּרְתְּמִ֔ים וְהִלְבִּ֙ישׁוּ֙ אֶת־הָאִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ חָפֵ֣ץ בִּֽיקָרֹ֑ו וְהִרְכִּיבֻ֤הוּ עַל־הַסּוּס֙ בִּרְחֹ֣וב הָעִ֔יר וְקָרְא֣וּ לְפָנָ֔יו כָּ֚כָה יֵעָשֶׂ֣ה לָאִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ חָפֵ֥ץ בִּיקָרֹֽו׃

Lit: and let be delivered the robe and horse to the hand of one of princes of the king most noble that he may array the man whom the king delights to honor and parade him on horseback through square the city and proclaim before him thus shall it be done to the man whom the king delights to honor

KJV: And let this apparel and horse be delivered to the hand of one of the king's most noble princes, that they may array the man withal whom the king delighteth to honour, and bring him on horseback through the street of the city, and proclaim before him, Thus shall it be done to the man whom the king delighteth to honour.
References

"proclaim"
Ge 41:43: He made him to ride in the second chariot which he had; and they cried before him: Bow the knee: and he made him ruler over all the land of Egypt.
1Ki 1:33: 34: The king also said to them: Take with you the servants of your lord: and cause Solomon my son to ride upon my own mule: and bring him down to Gihon:
Zec 9:9: Rejoice greatly: O daughter of Zion; shout: O daughter of Jerusalem: look: your King comes to you: he is just: and having salvation; lowly: and riding upon an ass: and upon a colt the foal of an ass.

 וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ לְהָמָ֗ן מַ֠הֵר קַ֣ח אֶת־הַלְּב֤וּשׁ וְאֶת־הַסּוּס֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבַּ֔רְתָּ וַֽעֲשֵׂה־כֵן֙ לְמָרְדֳּכַ֣י הַיְּהוּדִ֔י הַיֹּושֵׁ֖ב בְּשַׁ֣עַר הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ אַל־תַּפֵּ֣ל דָּבָ֔ר מִכֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּֽרְתָּ׃

H4116מַ֠הֵרma-hêr   (V-Piel-Imp-ms)
H4116 מָהַר mâhar maw-har a primitive root; properly, to be liquid or flow easily, i.e. (by implication); to hurry (in a good or a bad sense); often used (with another verb) adverbially, promptly; be carried headlong, fearful, (cause to make, in, make) haste(-n, -ily), (be) hasty, (fetch, make ready) idiom quickly, rash, idiom shortly, (be so) idiom soon, make speed, idiom speedily, idiom straightway, idiom suddenly, swift. 		מַ֠הֵרma-hêr Hurry V-Piel-Imp-ms

H834כַּאֲשֶׁ֣רka-’ă-šer   (Prep-k | Pro-r)

10 Then the king said to Haman, Make haste, and take the apparel and the horse, as you have said, and do even so to Mordecai the Jew, that sits at the king's gate: not lething fail of all that you have spoken.Esther 6:10
Stats
Rank: #8720 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 211 characters, 36 words, 162 letters, 62 vowels, 100 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ לְהָמָ֗ן מַ֠הֵר קַ֣ח אֶת־הַלְּב֤וּשׁ וְאֶת־הַסּוּס֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבַּ֔רְתָּ וַֽעֲשֵׂה־כֵן֙ לְמָרְדֳּכַ֣י הַיְּהוּדִ֔י הַיֹּושֵׁ֖ב בְּשַׁ֣עַר הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ אַל־תַּפֵּ֣ל דָּבָ֔ר מִכֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּֽרְתָּ׃

Lit: And said the king to Haman Hurry take the robe and the horse as you have suggested and do so for Mordecai the Jew who sits within gate of the king nothing leave undone let nothing of all that you have spoken

KJV: Then the king said to Haman, Make haste, and take the apparel and the horse, as thou hast said, and do even so to Mordecai the Jew, that sitteth at the king's gate: let nothing fail of all that thou hast spoken.
References

"Make haste"
Da 4:37: Now I Nebuchadnezzar praise and extol and honour the King of heaven: all whose works are truth: and his ways judgment: and those that walk in pride he is able to abase.
Lu 14:11: For whoever exalts himself will be abased; and he who humbles himself will be exalted.
Re 18:7: How much she has glorified herself: and lived deliciously: so much torment and sorrow give her: for she says in her heart: I sit a queen: and am no widow: and will see no sorrow.

"let nothing fail"
2Ki 10:10: Know now that there will fall to the not earthhing of the word of the LORD: which the LORD spoke concerning the house of Ahab: for the LORD has done that which He spoke by His servant Elijah.

 וַיִּקַּ֤ח הָמָן֙ אֶת־הַלְּב֣וּשׁ וְאֶת־הַסּ֔וּס וַיַּלְבֵּ֖שׁ אֶֽת־מָרְדֳּכָ֑י וַיַּרְכִּיבֵ֙הוּ֙ בִּרְחֹ֣וב הָעִ֔יר וַיִּקְרָ֣א לְפָנָ֔יו כָּ֚כָה יֵעָשֶׂ֣ה לָאִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ חָפֵ֥ץ בִּיקָרֹֽו׃

H834אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection., 		אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer whom Pro-r

11 Then took Haman the apparel and the horse, and arrayed Mordecai, and brought him on horseback through the street of the city, and proclaimed before him, Thus will it be done to the man whom the king delights to honour.Esther 6:11
Stats
Counts: 223 characters, 36 words, 179 letters, 66 vowels, 113 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח הָמָן֙ אֶת־הַלְּב֣וּשׁ וְאֶת־הַסּ֔וּס וַיַּלְבֵּ֖שׁ אֶֽת־מָרְדֳּכָ֑י וַיַּרְכִּיבֵ֙הוּ֙ בִּרְחֹ֣וב הָעִ֔יר וַיִּקְרָ֣א לְפָנָ֔יו כָּ֚כָה יֵעָשֶׂ֣ה לָאִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ חָפֵ֥ץ בִּיקָרֹֽו׃

Lit: So took Haman the robe and the horse and arrayed Mordecai and led him on horseback through square the city and proclaimed before him thus shall it be done to the man whom the king delights to honor

KJV: Then took Haman the apparel and the horse, and arrayed Mordecai, and brought him on horseback through the street of the city, and proclaimed before him, Thus shall it be done unto the man whom the king delighteth to honour.

"took Hamon"

Lu 1:52: He has put down the mighty from their seats: and exalted them of low degree.
Re 3:9: Look: I will make them of the synagogue of Satan: which say they are Jews: and not are: but do lie; look: I will make them to come and worship before your feet: and to know that I have loved you.

"and arrayed"

Haman’s Downfall Begins

וַיָּ֥שָׁב מָרְדֳּכַ֖י אֶל־שַׁ֣עַר הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וְהָמָן֙ נִדְחַ֣ף אֶל־בֵּיתֹ֔ו אָבֵ֖ל וַחֲפ֥וּי רֹֽאשׁ׃

12 Mordecai came again to the king's gate. But Haman hasted to his house mourning, and having his head covered.Esther 6:12
Stats
Counts: 112 characters, 18 words, 89 letters, 37 vowels, 52 consonants
Translation

Lit: And afterward went back Mordecai to gate Of the king but Haman hurried to his house mourning and with covered his head

KJV: And Mordecai came again to the king's gate. But Haman hasted to his house mourning, and having his head covered.

"hasted to his house"

H2490 חָלַל châlal khaw-lal a primitive root (compare חָלָה); also denominative (from חָלִיל); properly, to bore, i.e. (by implication) to wound, to dissolve; figuratively, to profane (a person, place or thing), to break (ones word), to begin (as if by an opening wedge); to play (the flute); begin (idiom men began), defile, idiom break, defile, idiom eat (as common things), idiom first, idiom gather the grape thereof, idiom take inheritance, pipe, player on instruments, pollute, (cast as) profane (self), prostitute, slay (slain), sorrow, stain, wound. 		הַחִלּ֨וֹתָha-ḥil-lō-w-ṯā you have begun V-Hifil-Perf-2ms

13 Haman told Zeresh his wife and all his friends every thing that had befallen him. Then said his wise men and Zeresh his wife to him, If Mordecai be of the seed of the Jews, before whom you have begun to fall, you will not prevail against him, but will surely fall before him.Esther 6:13
Stats
Counts: 287 characters, 48 words, 225 letters, 83 vowels, 142 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיְסַפֵּ֨ר הָמָ֜ן לְזֶ֤רֶשׁ אִשְׁתֹּו֙ וּלְכָל־אֹ֣הֲבָ֔יו אֵ֖ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר קָרָ֑הוּ וַיֹּ֩אמְרוּ֩ לֹ֨ו חֲכָמָ֜יו וְזֶ֣רֶשׁ אִשְׁתֹּ֗ו אִ֣ם מִזֶּ֣רַע הַיְּהוּדִ֡ים מָרְדֳּכַ֞י אֲשֶׁר֩ הַחִלֹּ֨ותָ לִנְפֹּ֤ל לְפָנָיו֙ לֹא־תוּכַ֣ל לֹ֔ו כִּֽי־נָפֹ֥ול תִּפֹּ֖ול לְפָנָֽיו׃

Lit: And when told Haman Zeresh his wife and all his friends everything that had happened to him and said to him his wise men and Zeresh his wife if is a descendant of the Jews Mordecai whom you have begun to fall before not you will prevail against him but surely will fall before him

KJV: And Haman told Zeresh his wife and all his friends every thing that had befallen him. Then said his wise men and Zeresh his wife unto him, If Mordecai [be] of the seed of the Jews, before whom thou hast begun to fall, thou shalt not prevail against him, but shalt surely fall before him.
References

"Zeresh"
Es 5:10-14: Nevertheless Haman refrained himself: and when he came home: he sent and called for his friends: and Zeresh his wife.

"said his wise"
Ge 41:8: It came to pass in the morning that his spirit was troubled; and he sent and called for all the magicians of Egypt: and all the wise men thereof: and Pharaoh told them his dream; but there was none that could interpret them to Pharaoh.
Da 2:12: For this cause the king was angry and very furious: and commanded to destroy all the wise men of Babylon.

"If Mordecai"
Ge 40:19: Yet within 3 days will Pharaoh lift up your head from off you: and will hang you on a tree; and the birds will eat your flesh from off you.
1Sa 28:19: 20: Moreover the LORD will also deliver Israel with you into the hand of the Philistines: and to morrow will you and your sons be with me: the LORD also will deliver the host of Israel into the hand of the Philistines.
Job 15:24: Trouble and anguish will make him afraid; they will prevail against him: as a king ready to the battle.
Da 5:26-28: This is the interpretation of the thing: MENE; God has numbered your kingdom: and finished it.
Zec 12:2: 3: Look: I will make Jerusalem a cup of trembling to all the people round about: when they will be in the siege both against Judah and against Jerusalem.

"but shalt surely"
Job 16:2: I have heard many such things: miserable comforters are you all.
Pr 28:18: Whoever walks uprightly will be saved: but he who is perverse in his ways will fall at once.
Ho 14:9: Who is wise: and He will understand these things? prudent: and He will know them? for the ways of the LORD are right: and the just will walk in them: but the transgressors will fall therein.

14 While they were yet talking with him, came the king's chamberlains, and hasted to bring Haman to the banquet that Esther had prepared.Esther 6:14

KJV: And while they were yet talking with him, came the king's chamberlains, and hasted to bring Haman unto the banquet that Esther had prepared.

"hasted to bring"

7
Esther’s Second Banquet

Esther Pleads for Her People

H4436הַמַּלְכָּֽה׃ham-mal-kāh.   (Art | N-fs)
H4436 מַלְכָּה malkâh mal-kaw feminine of מֶלֶךְ; a queen; queen. 		הַמַּלְכָּֽה׃ham-mal-kāh. Queen Art | N-fs
1 So the king and Haman came to banquet with Esther the queen.Esther 7:1
Stats
Counts: 60 characters, 12 words, 48 letters, 19 vowels, 29 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ וְהָמָ֔ן לִשְׁתֹּ֖ות עִם־אֶסְתֵּ֥ר הַמַּלְכָּֽה׃

Lit: So went the king and Haman to dine with Esther Queen

KJV: So the king and Haman came to banquet with Esther the queen.
References

"banquet"
Es 3:15: The posts went out: being hastened by the king's commandment: and the decree was given in Shushan the palace. And the king and Haman sat down to drink; but the city Shushan was perplexed.
Es 5:8: If I have found favour in the sight of the king: and if it please the king to grant my petition: and to perform my request: let the king and Haman come to the banquet that I will prepare for them: and I will do to morrow as the king has said.

 וַיֹּאמֶר֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ לְאֶסְתֵּ֜ר גַּ֣ם בַּיֹּ֤ום הַשֵּׁנִי֙ בְּמִשְׁתֵּ֣ה הַיַּ֔יִן מַה־שְּׁאֵלָתֵ֛ךְ אֶסְתֵּ֥ר הַמַּלְכָּ֖ה וְתִנָּ֣תֵֽן לָ֑ךְ וּמַה־בַּקָּשָׁתֵ֛ךְ עַד־חֲצִ֥י הַמַּלְכ֖וּת וְתֵעָֽשׂ׃

2 The king said again to Esther on the second day at the banquet of wine, What is your petition, queen Esther? and it will be granted you: and what is your request? and it will be performed, even to the half of the kingdom.Esther 7:2
Stats
Counts: 232 characters, 36 words, 177 letters, 66 vowels, 111 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ לְאֶסְתֵּ֜ר גַּ֣ם בַּיֹּ֤ום הַשֵּׁנִי֙ בְּמִשְׁתֵּ֣ה הַיַּ֔יִן מַה־שְּׁאֵלָתֵ֛ךְ אֶסְתֵּ֥ר הַמַּלְכָּ֖ה וְתִנָּ֣תֵֽן לָ֑ךְ וּמַה־בַּקָּשָׁתֵ֛ךְ עַד־חֲצִ֥י הַמַּלְכ֖וּת וְתֵעָֽשׂ׃

Lit: And said the king to Esther again on the day second at the banquet of wine what is your petition Esther Queen and it shall be granted you and what is your request up to half the kingdom And it shall be done

KJV: And the king said again unto Esther on the second day at the banquet of wine, What is thy petition, queen Esther? and it shall be granted thee: and what [is] thy request? and it shall be performed, [even] to the half of the kingdom.
References

"the king said"
Es 5:6: The king said to Esther at the banquet of wine: What is your petition? and it will be granted you: and what is your request? even to the half of the kingdom it will be performed.
Joh 16:24: Hitherto have you not askedhing in my name: ask: and you will receive: that your joy may be full.

 וַתַּ֨עַן אֶסְתֵּ֤ר הַמַּלְכָּה֙ וַתֹּאמַ֔ר אִם־מָצָ֨אתִי חֵ֤ן בְּעֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְאִם־עַל־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ טֹ֑וב תִּנָּֽתֶן־לִ֤י נַפְשִׁי֙ בִּשְׁאֵ֣לָתִ֔י וְעַמִּ֖י בְּבַקָּשָׁתִֽי׃

H5315נַפְשִׁי֙nap̄-šî   (N-fsc | 1cs)
H5315 נֶפֶשׁ nephesh neh-fesh from נָפַשׁ; properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental); any, appetite, beast, body, breath, creature, idiom dead(-ly), desire, idiom (dis-) contented, idiom fish, ghost, phrase greedy, he, heart(-y), (hath, idiom jeopardy of) life (idiom in jeopardy), lust, man, me, mind, mortally, one, own, person, pleasure, (her-, him-, my-, thy-) self, them (your) -selves, phrase slay, soul, phrase tablet, they, thing, (idiom she) will, idiom would have it. 		נַפְשִׁי֙nap̄-šî my life N-fsc | 1cs
H7596בִּשְׁאֵ֣לָתִ֔יbiš-’ê-lā-ṯî,   (Prep-b | N-fsc | 1cs)
H7596 שְׁאֵלָה shᵉʼêlâh sheh-ay-law or שֵׁלָה; (1 Samuel 1:17), from שָׁאַל; a petition; by implication, a loan; loan, petition, request. 		בִּשְׁאֵ֣לָתִ֔יbiš-’ê-lā-ṯî, at my petition Prep-b | N-fsc | 1cs
H5971וְעַמִּ֖יwə-‘am-mî   (Conj-w | N-msc | 1cs)
H5971 עַם ʻam am from עָמַם; a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock; folk, men, nation, people. 		וְעַמִּ֖יwə-‘am-mî and my people Conj-w | N-msc | 1cs
H1246בְּבַקָּשָׁתִֽי׃bə-ḇaq-qā-šā-ṯî.   (Prep-b | N-fsc | 1cs)

3 Then Esther the queen answered and said, If I have found favour in your sight, O king, and if it please the king, let my life be given me at my petition, and my people at my request:Esther 7:3
Stats
Counts: 181 characters, 33 words, 138 letters, 54 vowels, 84 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַתַּ֨עַן אֶסְתֵּ֤ר הַמַּלְכָּה֙ וַתֹּאמַ֔ר אִם־מָצָ֨אתִי חֵ֤ן בְּעֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְאִם־עַל־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ טֹ֑וב תִּנָּֽתֶן־לִ֤י נַפְשִׁי֙ בִּשְׁאֵ֣לָתִ֔י וְעַמִּ֖י בְּבַקָּשָׁתִֽי׃

Lit: and answered Esther Queen and said if I have found favor in your sight king and if on the king it pleases let be given me my life at my petition and my people at my request

KJV: Then Esther the queen answered and said, If I have found favour in thy sight, O king, and if it please the king, let my life be given me at my petition, and my people at my request:
References

"let my life"
Es 7:7: The king arising from the banquet of wine in his wrath went into the palace garden: and Haman stood up to make request for his life to Esther the queen; for he saw that there was evil determined against him by the king.
1Ki 20:31: His servants said to him: Look now: we have heard that the kings of the house of Israel are merciful kings: let us: I pray you: put sackcloth on our loins: and ropes upon our heads: and go out to the king of Israel: perhaps he will save your life.
2Ki 1:13: He sent again a captain of the third 50 with His 50. And the third captain of 50 went up: and came and fell on His knees before Elijah: and besought Him: and said to Him: O man of God: I pray you: let my life: and the life of these 50 your servants: be precious in your sight.
Job 2:4: Satan answered the LORD: and said: Skin for skin: yes: all that a man has will He give for His life.
Jer 38:26: Then you will say to them: I presented my supplication before the king: that he not would cause me to return to Jonathan's house: to die there.

"my people"
Es 4:8: Also he gave him the copy of the writing of the decree that was given at Shushan to destroy them: to show it to Esther: and to declare it to her: and to charge her that she should go in to the king: to make supplication to him: and to make request before him for her people.
Ps 122:6-9: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: they will prosper that love you.

 כִּ֤י נִמְכַּ֙רְנוּ֙ אֲנִ֣י וְעַמִּ֔י לְהַשְׁמִ֖יד לַהֲרֹ֣וג וּלְאַבֵּ֑ד וְ֠אִלּוּ לַעֲבָדִ֨ים וְלִשְׁפָחֹ֤ות נִמְכַּ֙רְנוּ֙ הֶחֱרַ֔שְׁתִּי כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין הַצָּ֛ר שֹׁוֶ֖ה בְּנֵ֥זֶק הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ ס

H3588כִּ֤יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֤יkî for Conj

H2790 חָרַשׁ chârash khaw-rash a primitive root; to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness); idiom altogether, cease, conceal, be deaf, devise, ear, graven, imagine, leave off speaking, hold peace, plow(-er, man), be quiet, rest, practise secretly, keep silence, be silent, speak not a word, be still, hold tongue, worker. 		הֶחֱרַ֔שְׁתִּיhe-ḥĕ-raš-tî, I would have held my tongue V-Hifil-Perf-1cs

4 For we are sold, I and my people, to be destroyed, to be killed, and to perish. But if we had been sold for bondmen and bondwomen, I had held my tongue, although the enemy not could countervail the king's damage.Esther 7:4
Stats
Counts: 211 characters, 34 words, 162 letters, 62 vowels, 100 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֤י נִמְכַּ֙רְנוּ֙ אֲנִ֣י וְעַמִּ֔י לְהַשְׁמִ֖יד לַהֲרֹ֣וג וּלְאַבֵּ֑ד וְ֠אִלּוּ לַעֲבָדִ֨ים וְלִשְׁפָחֹ֤ות נִמְכַּ֙רְנוּ֙ הֶחֱרַ֔שְׁתִּי כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין הַצָּ֛ר שֹׁוֶ֖ה בְּנֵ֥זֶק הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ ס

Lit: for we have been sold I and my people to be destroyed to be killed and to be annihilated And as male and female slaves Had we been sold I would have held my tongue although not the enemy could compensate for loss of the king

KJV: For we are sold, I and my people, to be destroyed, to be slain, and to perish. But if we had been sold for bondmen and bondwomen, I had held my tongue, although the enemy could not countervail the king's damage.
References

"we are sold"
Es 3:9: If it please the king: let it be written that they may be destroyed: and I will pay 10000 talents of silver to the hands of those that have the charge of the business: to bring it into the king's treasuries.
Es 4:7: 8: Mordecai told him of all that had happened to him: and of the sum of the money that Haman had promised to pay to the king's treasuries for the Jews: to destroy them.
De 28:68: The LORD will bring you into Egypt again with ships: by the way whereof I spoke to you: You will see it no more again: and there you will be sold to your enemies for bondmen and bondwomen: and no man will buy you.
1Sa 22:23: Abide you with me: not fear: for he who seeks'>seeks my life seeks'>seeks your life: but with me you will be in safeguard.

"to be destroyed, etc"
Es 3:13: The letters were sent by posts into all the king's provinces: to destroy: to kill: and to cause to perish: all Jews: both young and old: little children and women: in one day: even upon the thirteenth day of the twelfth month: which is the month Adar: and to take the spoil of them for a prey.
Es 8:11: Wherein the king granted the Jews which were in every city to gather themselves together: and to stand for their life: to destroy: to kill: and to cause to perish: all the power of the people and province that would assault them: both little ones and women: and to take the spoil of them for a prey:
Ps 44:22: 23: Yes: for your sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.

"But if we"
Ge 37:26-28: Judah said to his brothers: What profit is it if we kill our brother: and conceal his blood?
De 28:68: The LORD will bring you into Egypt again with ships: by the way whereof I spoke to you: You will see it no more again: and there you will be sold to your enemies for bondmen and bondwomen: and no man will buy you.
Jos 9:23: Now therefore you are cursed: and there will none of you be freed from being bondmen: and hewers of wood and drawers of water for the house of my God.
Ne 5:5: Yet now our flesh is as the flesh of our brothers: our children as their children: and: indeed: we bring into bondage our sons and our daughters to be servants: and some of our daughters are brought to bondage already: neither is it in our power to redeem them; for other men have our lands and vineyards.
Joe 3:6: The children also of Judah and the children of Jerusalem have you sold to the Grecians: that you might remove them far from their border.
Am 2:6: Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of Israel: and for 4: I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because they sold the righteous for silver: and the poor for a pair of shoes;

"the enemy"
Es 7:6: Esther said: The adversary and enemy is this wicked Haman. Then Haman was afraid before the king and the queen.
Es 3:9: If it please the king: let it be written that they may be destroyed: and I will pay 10000 talents of silver to the hands of those that have the charge of the business: to bring it into the king's treasuries.

וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹ֔ושׁ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר לְאֶסְתֵּ֣ר הַמַּלְכָּ֑ה מִ֣י ה֥וּא זֶה֙ וְאֵֽי־זֶ֣ה ה֔וּא אֲשֶׁר־מְלָאֹ֥ו לִבֹּ֖ו לַעֲשֹׂ֥ות כֵּֽן׃

H1931ה֔וּאhū,   (Pro-3ms)
H1931 הוּא hûwʼ hoo of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who., 		ה֔וּאhū, is Pro-3ms
H834אֲשֶׁר־’ă-šer-   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection., 		אֲשֶׁר־’ă-šer- who Pro-r

H3651כֵּֽן׃kên.   (Adv)
H3651 כֵּן kên kane from כּוּן; properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles); phrase after that (this, -ward, -wards), as... as, phrase (for-) asmuch as yet, phrase be (for which) cause, phrase following, howbeit, in (the) like (manner, -wise), idiom the more, right, (even) so, state, straightway, such (thing), surely, phrase there (where) -fore, this, thus, true, well, idiom you., 		כֵּֽן׃kên. such a thing Adv
5 Then the king Ahasuerus answered and said to Esther the queen, Who is he, and where is he, that durst presume in his heart to do so?Esther 7:5
Stats
Counts: 134 characters, 24 words, 104 letters, 42 vowels, 62 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹ֔ושׁ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר לְאֶסְתֵּ֣ר הַמַּלְכָּ֑ה מִ֣י ה֥וּא זֶה֙ וְאֵֽי־זֶ֣ה ה֔וּא אֲשֶׁר־מְלָאֹ֥ו לִבֹּ֖ו לַעֲשֹׂ֥ות כֵּֽן׃

Lit: So answered King Ahasuerus and said to Esther Queen who is this one and where this one is who would dare presume in his heart to do such a thing

KJV: Then the king Ahasuerus answered and said unto Esther the queen, Who is he, and where is he, that durst presume in his heart to do so?
References

"Who is he"
Ge 27:33: Isaac trembled very exceedingly: and said: Who? where is he who has taken venison: and brought it me: and I have eaten of all before you came: and have blessed him? yes: and he will be blessed.
Job 9:24: The earth is given into the hand of the wicked: he covers the faces of the judges thereof; not if: where: and who is he?

"that durst, etc"
Ac 5:3: But Peter said: Ananias: why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Ghost: and to keep back part of the price of the land?

6 Esther said, The adversary and enemy is this wicked Haman. Then Haman was afraid before the king and the queen.Esther 7:6
Stats
Counts: 115 characters, 19 words, 92 letters, 35 vowels, 57 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר־אֶסְתֵּ֔ר אִ֚ישׁ צַ֣ר וְאֹויֵ֔ב הָמָ֥ן הָרָ֖ע הַזֶּ֑ה וְהָמָ֣ן נִבְעַ֔ת מִלִּפְנֵ֥י הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ וְהַמַּלְכָּֽה׃

Lit: and said Esther the adversary and enemy Haman Wicked is this so Haman was terrified before the king and queen

KJV: And Esther said, The adversary and enemy is this wicked Haman. Then Haman was afraid before the king and the queen.
References

"this wicked"
1Sa 24:13: As says the proverb of the ancients: Wickedness proceeds from the wicked: but my hand will not be upon you.
Ps 27:2: When the wicked: even my enemies and my foes: came upon me to eat up my flesh: they stumbled and fell.
Ps 139:19-22: Surely you will kill the wicked: O God: depart from me therefore: you bloody men.
Pr 24:24: 25: He who says to the wicked: You are righteous; him will the people curse: nations will abhor him:
Ec 5:8: If you see the oppression of the poor: and violent perverting of judgment and justice in a province: not marvel at the matter: for he who is higher than the high regards; and there be higher than they.
1Co 5:13: But them that are without God judges. Therefore put away from among yourselves that wicked person.
2Th 2:8: Then will that Wicked be revealed: whom the Lord will consume with the spirit of His mouth: and will destroy with the brightness of His coming:

"was afraid"
Ne 6:16: It came to pass: that when all our enemies heard thereof: and all the heathen that were about us saw these things: they were much cast down in their own eyes: for they perceived that this work was wrought of our God.
Job 15:21: 22: A dreadful sound is in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer will come upon him.
Job 18:5-12: Yes: the light of the wicked will be put out: and the spark of his fire will not shine.
Ps 73:5-9: 17-20: They are not in trouble as other men; neither are they plagued like other men.
Pr 16:14: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death: but a wise man will pacify it.
Isa 21:4: My heart panted: fearfulness affrighted me: the night of my pleasure has he turned into fear to me.
Da 5:5: 6: In the same hour came forth fingers of a man's hand: and wrote over against the candlestick upon the plaister of the wall of the king's palace: and the king saw the part of the hand that wrote.

H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֣יkî for Conj

H4428הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ham-me-leḵ.   (Art | N-ms)
H4428 מֶלֶךְ melek meh-lek from מָלַךְ; a king; king, royal. 		הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ham-me-leḵ. the king Art | N-ms
7 The king arising from the banquet of wine in his wrath went into the palace garden: and Haman stood up to make request for his life to Esther the queen; for he saw that there was evil determined against him by the king.Esther 7:7
Stats
Counts: 223 characters, 42 words, 177 letters, 68 vowels, 109 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֜לֶךְ קָ֤ם בַּחֲמָתֹו֙ מִמִּשְׁתֵּ֣ה הַיַּ֔יִן אֶל־גִּנַּ֖ת הַבִּיתָ֑ן וְהָמָ֣ן עָמַ֗ד לְבַקֵּ֤שׁ עַל־נַפְשֹׁו֙ מֵֽאֶסְתֵּ֣ר הַמַּלְכָּ֔ה כִּ֣י רָאָ֔ה כִּֽי־כָלְתָ֥ה אֵלָ֛יו הָרָעָ֖ה מֵאֵ֥ת הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃

Lit: And the king arose in his wrath from the banquet of wine and went into garden the palace but Haman stood pleading for his life before Esther Queen for he saw that was determined against him evil by the king

KJV: And the king arising from the banquet of wine in his wrath went into the palace garden: and Haman stood up to make request for his life to Esther the queen; for he saw that there was evil determined against him by the king.
References

"in his wrath"
Es 1:12: But the queen Vashti refused to come at the king's commandment by his chamberlains: therefore was the king very angry: and his anger burned in him.

"Haman"
Pr 14:19: The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
Isa 60:14: The sons also of them that afflicted you will come bending to you; and all they that despised you will bow themselves down at the soles of your feet; and they will call you: The city of the LORD: The Zion of the Holy one of Israel.
Re 3:9: Look: I will make them of the synagogue of Satan: which say they are Jews: and not are: but do lie; look: I will make them to come and worship before your feet: and to know that I have loved you.

"for he saw"
1Sa 20:7: 9: If he say thus: It is well; your servant will have peace: but if he be very angry: then be sure that evil is determined by him.
1Sa 25:17: Now therefore know and consider what you will do; for evil is determined against our master: and against all his household: for he is such a son of Belial: that a man cannot speak to him.
Ps 112:10: The wicked will see it: and be grieved; he will gnash with his teeth: and melt away: the desire of the wicked will perish.
Pr 19:12: The king's wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass.
Da 3:19: Then was Nebuchadnezzar full of fury: and the form of his visage was changed against Shadrach: Meshach: and Abednego: therefore he spoke: and commanded that they should heat the furnace 8 times more than it was wont to be heated.

 וְהַמֶּ֡לֶךְ שָׁב֩ מִגִּנַּ֨ת הַבִּיתָ֜ן אֶל־בֵּ֣ית ׀ מִשְׁתֵּ֣ה הַיַּ֗יִן וְהָמָן֙ נֹפֵ֔ל עַל־הַמִּטָּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶסְתֵּ֣ר עָלֶ֔יהָ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ הֲ֠גַם לִכְבֹּ֧ושׁ אֶת־הַמַּלְכָּ֛ה עִמִּ֖י בַּבָּ֑יִת הַדָּבָ֗ר יָצָא֙ מִפִּ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וּפְנֵ֥י הָמָ֖ן חָפֽוּ׃ ס

H2645חָפֽוּ׃ḥā-p̄ū.   (V-Qal-Perf-3cp)
H2645 חָפָה châphâh khaw-faw a primitive root (compare חָפָא, חׇפַף); to cover; by implication, to veil, to encase, protect; ceil, cover, overlay. 		חָפֽוּ׃ḥā-p̄ū. they covered V-Qal-Perf-3cp
8 Then the king returned out of the palace garden into the place of the banquet of wine; and Haman was fallen upon the bed whereon Esther was. Then said the king, Will he force the queen also before me in the house? As the word went out of the king's mouth, they covered Haman's face.Esther 7:8
Stats
Rank: #4861 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 282 characters, 50 words, 220 letters, 87 vowels, 133 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֡לֶךְ שָׁב֩ מִגִּנַּ֨ת הַבִּיתָ֜ן אֶל־בֵּ֣ית ׀ מִשְׁתֵּ֣ה הַיַּ֗יִן וְהָמָן֙ נֹפֵ֔ל עַל־הַמִּטָּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶסְתֵּ֣ר עָלֶ֔יהָ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ הֲ֠גַם לִכְבֹּ֧ושׁ אֶת־הַמַּלְכָּ֛ה עִמִּ֖י בַּבָּ֑יִת הַדָּבָ֗ר יָצָא֙ מִפִּ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וּפְנֵ֥י הָמָ֖ן חָפֽוּ׃ ס

Lit: And when the king returned from garden the palace to the place of the banquet of wine and Haman had fallen across the couch where Esther was on that and said the king will also he assault the queen while I am in the house as the word left mouth of the king and face Of Haman they covered

KJV: Then the king returned out of the palace garden into the place of the banquet of wine; and Haman was fallen upon the bed whereon Esther was. Then said the king, Will he force the queen also before me in the house? As the word went out of the king's mouth, they covered Haman's face.
References

"the bed"
Es 1:6: Where were white: green: and blue: hangings: fastened with cords of fine linen and purple to silver rings and pillars of marble: the beds were of gold and silver: upon a pavement of red: and blue: and white: and black: marble.
Isa 49:23: Kings will be your nursing fathers: and their queens your nursing mothers: they will bow down to you with their face toward the earth: and lick up the dust of your feet; and you will know that I am the LORD: for they will not be ashamed that wait for me.

"they covered Haman's"
Es 6:12: Mordecai came again to the king's gate. But Haman hasted to his house mourning: and having his head covered.
Job 9:24: The earth is given into the hand of the wicked: he covers the faces of the judges thereof; not if: where: and who is he?
Isa 22:17: Look: the LORD will carry you away with a mighty captivity: and will surely cover you.

 וַיֹּ֣אמֶר חַ֠רְבֹונָה אֶחָ֨ד מִן־הַסָּרִיסִ֜ים לִפְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ גַּ֣ם הִנֵּה־הָעֵ֣ץ אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֪ה הָמָ֟ן לְֽמָרְדֳּכַ֞י אֲשֶׁ֧ר דִּבֶּר־טֹ֣וב עַל־הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ עֹמֵד֙ בְּבֵ֣ית הָמָ֔ן גָּבֹ֖הַּ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים אַמָּ֑ה וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ תְּלֻ֥הוּ עָלָֽיו׃

9 Harbonah, one of the chamberlains, said before the king, Look also, the gallows 50 cubits high, which Haman had made for Mordecai, who had spoken good for the king, stands in the house of Haman. Then the king said, Hang him thereon.Esther 7:9
Stats
Rank: #6043 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 243 characters, 34 words, 191 letters, 70 vowels, 121 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר חַ֠רְבֹונָה אֶחָ֨ד מִן־הַסָּרִיסִ֜ים לִפְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ גַּ֣ם הִנֵּה־הָעֵ֣ץ אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֪ה הָמָ֟ן לְֽמָרְדֳּכַ֞י אֲשֶׁ֧ר דִּבֶּר־טֹ֣וב עַל־הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ עֹמֵד֙ בְּבֵ֣ית הָמָ֔ן גָּבֹ֖הַּ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים אַמָּ֑ה וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ תְּלֻ֥הוּ עָלָֽיו׃

Lit: And said Harbona one of the eunuchs to the king also Look the gallows which made Haman for Mordecai who spoke good on behalf of the king is standing at the house of Haman High fifty cubits and said the king Hang him on it

KJV: And Harbonah, one of the chamberlains, said before the king, Behold also, the gallows fifty cubits high, which Haman had made for Mordecai, who had spoken good for the king, standeth in the house of Haman. Then the king said, Hang him thereon.
References

"Harbonah"
Es 1:10: On the seventh day: when the heart of the king was merry with wine: he commanded Mehuman: Biztha: Harbona: Bigtha: and Abagtha: Zethar: and Carcas: the 7 chamberlains that served in the presence of Ahasuerus the king:

"Harbona"
Es 6:14: While they were yet talking with him: came the king's chamberlains: and hasted to bring Haman to the banquet that Esther had prepared.
2Ki 9:32: He lifted up his face to the window: and said: Who is on my side? who? And there looked out to him two or 3 eunuchs.

"Behold"
Es 5:14: Then said Zeresh his wife and all his friends to him: Let a gallows be made of 50 cubits high: and to morrow speak you to the king that Mordecai may be hanged thereon: then go you in merrily with the king to the banquet. And the thing pleased Haman; and he caused the gallows to be made.
Job 27:20-23: Terrors take hold on him as waters: a tempest steals him away in the night.
Ps 7:15: 16: He made a pit: and digged it: and is fallen into the ditch which he made.
Ps 35:8: Let destruction come upon him at unawares; and let his net that he has hid catch himself: into that very destruction let him fall.
Ps 141:10: Let the wicked fall into their own nets: whilst that I withal escape.
Pr 11:5: 6: The righteousness of the perfect will direct his way: but the wicked will fall by his own wickedness.

"who had spoken"
Es 2:21-23: In those days: while Mordecai sat in the king's gate: two of the king's chamberlains: Bigthan and Teresh: of those which kept the door: were angry: and sought to lay hand on the king Ahasuerus.
Es 6:2: It was found written: that Mordecai had told of Bigthana and Teresh: two of the king's chamberlains: the keepers of the door: who sought to lay hand on the king Ahasuerus.

"Hang him thereon"
Es 9:25: But when Esther came before the king: he commanded by letters that his wicked device: which he devised against the Jews: should return upon his own head: and that he and his sons should be hanged on the gallows.
1Sa 17:51: Therefore David ran: and stood upon the Philistine: and took his sword: and drew it out of the sheath thereof: and killed him: and cut off his head therewith. And when the Philistines saw their champion was dead: they fled.
Ps 7:15: 16: He made a pit: and digged it: and is fallen into the ditch which he made.
Ps 9:15: 16: The heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made: in the net which they hid is their own foot taken.
Ps 35:8: Let destruction come upon him at unawares; and let his net that he has hid catch himself: into that very destruction let him fall.
Ps 37:35: 36: I have seen the wicked in great power: and spreading himself like a green bay tree.
Ps 73:19: How are they brought into desolation: as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.
Pr 11:5: 6: The righteousness of the perfect will direct his way: but the wicked will fall by his own wickedness.

10 So they hanged Haman on the gallows that he had prepared for Mordecai. Then was the king's wrath pacified.Esther 7:10
Stats
Rank: #7746 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 106 characters, 18 words, 85 letters, 30 vowels, 55 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיִּתְלוּ֙ אֶת־הָמָ֔ן עַל־הָעֵ֖ץ אֲשֶׁר־הֵכִ֣ין לְמָרְדֳּכָ֑י וַחֲמַ֥ת הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ שָׁכָֽכָה׃ פ

Lit: So they hanged Haman on the gallows that he had prepared for Mordecai And wrath of the king subsided

KJV: So they hanged Haman on the gallows that he had prepared for Mordecai. Then was the king's wrath pacified.
References

"Then was the king's"
Jg 15:7: Samson said to them: Though you have done this: yet will I be avenged of you: and after that I will cease.
Eze 5:13: Thus will my anger be accomplished: and I will cause my fury to rest upon them: and I will be comforted: and they will know that I the LORD have spoken it in my zeal: when I have accomplished my fury in them.
Zec 6:8: Then cried he upon me: and spoke to me: saying: Look: these that go toward the north country have quieted my spirit in the north country.

8
Esther Appeals for the Jews

Esther and Mordecai Persuade the King to Issue New Edict

בַּיֹּ֣ום הַה֗וּא נָתַ֞ן הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ֙ לְאֶסְתֵּ֣ר הַמַּלְכָּ֔ה אֶת־בֵּ֥ית הָמָ֖ן צֹרֵ֣ר [הַיְּהוּדִיִּים כ] (הַיְּהוּדִ֑ים ק) וּמָרְדֳּכַ֗י בָּ֚א לִפְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ כִּֽי־הִגִּ֥ידָה אֶסְתֵּ֖ר מַ֥ה הוּא־לָֽהּ׃

Hלָֽהּ׃lāh.   (Prep | 3fs)
 		לָֽהּ׃lāh. to her Prep | 3fs
1 On that day did the king Ahasuerus give the house of Haman the Jews' enemy to Esther the queen. And Mordecai came before the king; for Esther had told what he was to her.Esther 8:1
Stats
Counts: 174 characters, 31 words, 137 letters, 55 vowels, 82 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בַּיֹּ֣ום הַה֗וּא נָתַ֞ן הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ֙ לְאֶסְתֵּ֣ר הַמַּלְכָּ֔ה אֶת־בֵּ֥ית הָמָ֖ן צֹרֵ֣ר [הַיְּהוּדִיִּים כ] (הַיְּהוּדִ֑ים ק) וּמָרְדֳּכַ֗י בָּ֚א לִפְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ כִּֽי־הִגִּ֥ידָה אֶסְתֵּ֖ר מַ֥ה הוּא־לָֽהּ׃

Lit: On day that gave king Ahasuerus Esther Queen The house of Haman the enemy of the Jews the Jews and Mordecai came before the King for had told Esther what he was to her

KJV: On that day did the king Ahasuerus give the house of Haman the Jews' enemy unto Esther the queen. And Mordecai came before the king; for Esther had told what he was unto her.

H2885טַבַּעְתּ֗וֹṭab-ba‘-tōw,   (N-fsc | 3ms)
H2885 טַבַּעַת ṭabbaʻath tab-bah-ath from טָבַע; properly, a seal (as sunk into the wax), i.e. signet (for sealing); hence (generally) a ring of any kind; ring. 		טַבַּעְתּ֗וֹṭab-ba‘-tōw, his signet ring N-fsc | 3ms
H834אֲשֶׁ֤ר’ă-šer   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection., 		אֲשֶׁ֤ר’ă-šer which Pro-r

H2001הָמָֽן׃hā-mān.   (N-proper-ms)
H2001 הָמָן Hâmân haw-mawn of foreign derivation; Haman, a Persian vizier; Haman. 		הָמָֽן׃hā-mān. of Haman N-proper-ms
2 The king took off his ring, which he had taken from Haman, and gave it to Mordecai. And Esther set Mordecai over the house of Haman.Esther 8:2
Stats
Counts: 138 characters, 24 words, 108 letters, 43 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיָּ֨סַר הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֶת־טַבַּעְתֹּ֗ו אֲשֶׁ֤ר הֶֽעֱבִיר֙ מֵֽהָמָ֔ן וַֽיִּתְּנָ֖הּ לְמָרְדֳּכָ֑י וַתָּ֧שֶׂם אֶסְתֵּ֛ר אֶֽת־מָרְדֳּכַ֖י עַל־בֵּ֥ית הָמָֽן׃ פ

Lit: So took off the king his signet ring which he had taken from Haman and gave it to Mordecai And appointed Esther Mordecai over the house of Haman

KJV: And the king took off his ring, which he had taken from Haman, and gave it unto Mordecai. And Esther set Mordecai over the house of Haman.
References

"his ring"
Es 3:10: The king took his ring from his hand: and gave it to Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite: the Jews' enemy.
Ge 41:42: Pharaoh took off his ring from his hand: and put it upon Joseph's hand: and arrayed him in vestures of fine linen: and put a gold chain about his neck;
Isa 22:19-22: I will drive you from your station: and from your state will he pull you down.
Lu 15:22: But the father said to his servants: Bring forth the best robe: and put it on him; and put a ring on his hand: and shoes on his feet:

"Esther set"
2Sa 9:7-10: David said to him: not Fear: for I will surely show you kindness for Jonathan your father's sake: and will restore you all the land of Saul your father; and you will eat bread at my table continually.
Ps 37:34: Wait on the LORD: and keep His way: and He will exalt you to inherit the land: when the wicked are cut off: you will see it.
Ec 2:18: 19-26: Yes: I hated all my labour which I had taken under the sun: because I should leave it to the man that will be after me.
Ec 5:13: 14: There is a sore evil which I have seen under the sun: namely: riches kept for the owners thereof to their hurt.
Da 2:48: Then the king made Daniel a great man: and gave him many great gifts: and made him ruler over the whole province of Babylon: and chief of the governors over all the wise men of Babylon.

וַתֹּ֣וסֶף אֶסְתֵּ֗ר וַתְּדַבֵּר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַתִּפֹּ֖ל לִפְנֵ֣י רַגְלָ֑יו וַתֵּ֣בְךְּ וַתִּתְחַנֶּן־לֹ֗ו לְהַֽעֲבִיר֙ אֶת־רָעַת֙ הָמָ֣ן הָֽאֲגָגִ֔י וְאֵת֙ מַֽחֲשַׁבְתֹּ֔ו אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָשַׁ֖ב עַל־הַיְּהוּדִֽים׃

H834אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). H2803חָשַׁ֖בḥā-šaḇ   (V-Qal-Perf-3ms)
H2803 חָשַׁב châshab khaw-shab a primitive root; properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute; (make) account (of), conceive, consider, count, cunning (man, work, workman), devise, esteem, find out, forecast, hold, imagine, impute, invent, be like, mean, purpose, reckon(-ing be made), regard, think. 		חָשַׁ֖בḥā-šaḇ he had devised V-Qal-Perf-3ms

3 Esther spoke yet again before the king, and fell down at his feet, and besought him with tears to put away the mischief of Haman the Agagite, and his device that he had devised against the Jews.Esther 8:3
Stats
Counts: 198 characters, 35 words, 157 letters, 61 vowels, 96 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣וסֶף אֶסְתֵּ֗ר וַתְּדַבֵּר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַתִּפֹּ֖ל לִפְנֵ֣י רַגְלָ֑יו וַתֵּ֣בְךְּ וַתִּתְחַנֶּן־לֹ֗ו לְהַֽעֲבִיר֙ אֶת־רָעַת֙ הָמָ֣ן הָֽאֲגָגִ֔י וְאֵת֙ מַֽחֲשַׁבְתֹּ֔ו אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָשַׁ֖ב עַל־הַיְּהוּדִֽים׃

Lit: And again Esther and spoke to the king and fell down at his feet and with tears and implored him to counteract the evil of Haman the Agagite and the scheme which he had devised against the Jews

KJV: And Esther spake yet again before the king, and fell down at his feet, and besought him with tears to put away the mischief of Haman the Agagite, and his device that he had devised against the Jews.
References

"fell"
1Sa 25:24: Fell at his feet: and said: Upon me: my lord: upon me let this iniquity be: and let your handmaid: I pray you: speak in your audience: and hear the words of your handmaid.
2Ki 4:27: When she came to the man of God to the hill: she caught Him by the feet: but Gehazi came near to thrust her away. And the man of God said: Let her alone; for her soul is vexed within her: and the LORD has hid it from me: and has not told me.

"besought him with tears"
Isa 38:2: Then Hezekiah turned His face toward the wall: and prayed to the LORD:
Ho 12:4: Yes: he had power over the angel: and prevailed: he wept: and made supplication to him: he found him in Bethel: and there he spoke with us;
Heb 5:7: Who in the days of his flesh: when he had offered up prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears to him that was able to save him from death: and was heard in that he feared;

"mischief"
Es 3:8-15: Haman said to king Ahasuerus: There is a certain people scattered abroad and dispersed among the people in all the provinces of your kingdom; and their laws are diverse from all people; neither keep they the king's laws: therefore it is not for the king's profit to suffer them.
Es 7:4: For we are sold: I and my people: to be destroyed: to be killed: and to perish. But if we had been sold for bondmen and bondwomen: I had held my tongue: although the enemy not could countervail the king's damage.

4 Then the king held out the golden sceptre toward Esther. So Esther arose, and stood before the king,Esther 8:4
Stats
Counts: 100 characters, 16 words, 80 letters, 29 vowels, 51 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤ושֶׁט הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ לְאֶסְתֵּ֔ר אֵ֖ת שַׁרְבִ֣ט הַזָּהָ֑ב וַתָּ֣קָם אֶסְתֵּ֔ר וַֽתַּעֲמֹ֖ד לִפְנֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃

Lit: And held out the king toward Esther Scepter the golden so arose Esther and stood before the king

KJV: Then the king held out the golden sceptre toward Esther. So Esther arose, and stood before the king,
References

"held out"
Es 4:11: All the king's servants: and the people of the king's provinces: do know: that whoever: whether man or woman: will come to the king into the inner court: who not is called: there is one law of his to put him to death: except such to whom the king will hold out the golden sceptre: that he may live: but I not have been called to come in to the king these 30 days.
Es 5:2: It was so: when the king saw Esther the queen standing in the court: that she obtained favour in his sight: and the king held out to Esther the golden sceptre that was in his hand. So Esther drew near: and touched the top of the sceptre.

 וַ֠תֹּאמֶר אִם־עַל־הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ טֹ֜וב וְאִם־מָצָ֧אתִי חֵ֣ן לְפָנָ֗יו וְכָשֵׁ֤ר הַדָּבָר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְטֹובָ֥ה אֲנִ֖י בְּעֵינָ֑יו יִכָּתֵ֞ב לְהָשִׁ֣יב אֶת־הַסְּפָרִ֗ים מַחֲשֶׁ֜בֶת הָמָ֤ן בֶּֽן־הַמְּדָ֙תָא֙ הָאֲגָגִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֣ר כָּתַ֗ב לְאַבֵּד֙ אֶת־הַיְּהוּדִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּכָל־מְדִינֹ֥ות הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃

H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). H4428הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ham-me-leḵ.   (Art | N-ms)

5 Said, If it please the king, and if I have found favour in his sight, and the thing seem right before the king, and I be pleasing in his eyes, let it be written to reverse the letters devised by Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, which he wrote to destroy the Jews which are in all the king's provinces:Esther 8:5
Stats
Counts: 317 characters, 52 words, 244 letters, 92 vowels, 152 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַ֠תֹּאמֶר אִם־עַל־הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ טֹ֜וב וְאִם־מָצָ֧אתִי חֵ֣ן לְפָנָ֗יו וְכָשֵׁ֤ר הַדָּבָר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְטֹובָ֥ה אֲנִ֖י בְּעֵינָ֑יו יִכָּתֵ֞ב לְהָשִׁ֣יב אֶת־הַסְּפָרִ֗ים מַחֲשֶׁ֜בֶת הָמָ֤ן בֶּֽן־הַמְּדָ֙תָא֙ הָאֲגָגִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֣ר כָּתַ֗ב לְאַבֵּד֙ אֶת־הַיְּהוּדִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּכָל־מְדִינֹ֥ות הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃

Lit: and said if on the king it pleases and if I have found favor in his sight and seems right the thing to the king and am pleasing I in his eyes let it be written to revoke the letters devised by Haman son of Hammedatha the Agagite which he wrote to annihilate the Jews who are in all provinces of the king

KJV: And said, If it please the king, and if I have found favour in his sight, and the thing seem right before the king, and I [be] pleasing in his eyes, let it be written to reverse the letters devised by Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, which he wrote to destroy the Jews which [are] in all the king's provinces:
References

"and, if I"
Es 7:3: Then Esther the queen answered and said: If I have found favour in your sight: O king: and if it please the king: let my life be given me at my petition: and my people at my request:
Ex 33:13: 16: Now therefore: I pray you: if I have found grace in your sight: show me now your way: that I may know you: that I may find grace in your sight: and consider that this nation is your people.
1Sa 20:29: He said: Let me go: I pray you; for our family has a sacrifice in the city; and my brother: he has commanded me to be there: and now: if I have found favour in your eyes: let me get away: I pray you: and see my brothers. Therefore he comes not to the king's table.

"I be pleasing"
Es 2:4: 17: Let the maiden which pleases the king be queen instead of Vashti. And the thing pleased the king; and he did so.

"letters"
Es 3:12: 13: Then were the king's scribes called on the thirteenth day of the first month: and there was written according to all that Haman had commanded to the king's lieutenants: and to the governors that were over every province: and to the rulers of every people of every province according to the writing thereof: and to every people after their language; in the name of king Ahasuerus was it written: and sealed with the king's ring.

 כִּ֠י אֵיכָכָ֤ה אוּכַל֙ וְֽרָאִ֔יתִי בָּרָעָ֖ה אֲשֶׁר־יִמְצָ֣א אֶת־עַמִּ֑י וְאֵֽיכָכָ֤ה אוּכַל֙ וְֽרָאִ֔יתִי בְּאָבְדַ֖ן מֹולַדְתִּֽי׃ ס

H3588כִּ֠יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֠יkî For Conj

6 For how can I endure to see the evil that will come to my people? or how can I endure to see the destruction of my kindred?Esther 8:6
Stats
Counts: 126 characters, 26 words, 98 letters, 40 vowels, 58 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֠י אֵיכָכָ֤ה אוּכַל֙ וְֽרָאִ֔יתִי בָּרָעָ֖ה אֲשֶׁר־יִמְצָ֣א אֶת־עַמִּ֑י וְאֵֽיכָכָ֤ה אוּכַל֙ וְֽרָאִ֔יתִי בְּאָבְדַ֖ן מֹולַדְתִּֽי׃ ס

Lit: For how can I endure and to see the evil that will come to my people Or how can I endure and to see the destruction of my countrymen

KJV: For how can I endure to see the evil that shall come unto my people? or how can I endure to see the destruction of my kindred?
References

"For how"
Ge 44:34: For how will I go up to my father: and the lad be not with me? lest perhaps I see the evil that will come on my father.
Jer 4:19: My bowels: my bowels! I am pained at my very heart; my heart makes a noise in me; I cannot hold my peace: because you have heard: O my soul: the sound of the trumpet: the alarm of war.
Jer 9:1: Oh that my head were waters: and my eyes a fountain of tears: that I might weep day and night for the killed of the daughter of my people!
Lu 19:41: 42: When he was come near: he beheld the city: and wept over it:
Ro 9:2: 3: That I have great heaviness and continual sorrow in my heart.
Ro 10:1: Brothers: my heart's desire and prayer to God for Israel is: that they might be saved.

"the evil"
Es 7:4: For we are sold: I and my people: to be destroyed: to be killed: and to perish. But if we had been sold for bondmen and bondwomen: I had held my tongue: although the enemy not could countervail the king's damage.
Ne 2:3: Said to the king: Let the king live for ever: why not should my face be sad: when the city: the place of my fathers' sepulchres: lieth waste: and the gates thereof are consumed with fire?

וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹשׁ֙ לְאֶסְתֵּ֣ר הַמַּלְכָּ֔ה וּֽלְמָרְדֳּכַ֖י הַיְּהוּדִ֑י הִנֵּ֨ה בֵית־הָמָ֜ן נָתַ֣תִּי לְאֶסְתֵּ֗ר וְאֹתֹו֙ תָּל֣וּ עַל־הָעֵ֔ץ עַ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥ח יָדֹ֖ו [בַּיְּהוּדִיִּים כ] (בַּיְּהוּדִֽים׃ ק)

H834אֲשֶׁר־’ă-šer-   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection., 		אֲשֶׁר־’ă-šer- that Pro-r

H3064(בַּיְּהוּדִֽים׃)(bay-yə-hū-ḏîm.   (Prep-b, Art | N-proper-mp)
H3064 יְהוּדִי Yᵉhûwdîy yeh-hoo-dee patronymically from יְהוּדָה; a Jehudite (i.e. Judaite or Jew), or descendant of Jehudah (i.e. Judah); Jew. 		(בַּיְּהוּדִֽים׃)(bay-yə-hū-ḏîm. on the Jews Prep-b, Art | N-proper-mp
Hq)   ()
 		q)
7 Then the king Ahasuerus said to Esther the queen and to Mordecai the Jew, Look, I have given Esther the house of Haman, and him they have hanged upon the gallows, because he laid his hand upon the Jews.Esther 8:7
Stats
Counts: 206 characters, 35 words, 163 letters, 67 vowels, 96 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹשׁ֙ לְאֶסְתֵּ֣ר הַמַּלְכָּ֔ה וּֽלְמָרְדֳּכַ֖י הַיְּהוּדִ֑י הִנֵּ֨ה בֵית־הָמָ֜ן נָתַ֣תִּי לְאֶסְתֵּ֗ר וְאֹתֹו֙ תָּל֣וּ עַל־הָעֵ֔ץ עַ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥ח יָדֹ֖ו [בַּיְּהוּדִיִּים כ] (בַּיְּהוּדִֽים׃ ק)

Lit: and said King Ahasuerus to Esther Queen and Mordecai the Jew indeed the house of Haman I have given Esther and him they have hanged on the gallows upon that he tried to lay his hand Jews on the Jews

KJV: Then the king Ahasuerus said unto Esther the queen and to Mordecai the Jew, Behold, I have given Esther the house of Haman, and him they have hanged upon the gallows, because he laid his hand upon the Jews.
References

"Behold"
Es 8:1: On that day did the king Ahasuerus give the house of Haman the Jews' enemy to Esther the queen. And Mordecai came before the king; for Esther had told what he was to her.
Pr 13:22: A good man leaves an inheritance to his children's children: and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just.

"him they have hanged"
Es 7:10: So they hanged Haman on the gallows that he had prepared for Mordecai. Then was the king's wrath pacified.
Ga 3:13: Christ has redeemed us from the curse of the law: being made a curse for us: for it is written: Cursed is every one that hangs on a tree:

 וְ֠אַתֶּם כִּתְב֨וּ עַל־הַיְּהוּדִ֜ים כַּטֹּ֤וב בְּעֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ בְּשֵׁ֣ם הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְחִתְמ֖וּ בְּטַבַּ֣עַת הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ כִּֽי־כְתָ֞ב אֲשֶׁר־נִכְתָּ֣ב בְּשֵׁם־הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ וְנַחְתֹּ֛ום בְּטַבַּ֥עַת הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֵ֥ין לְהָשִֽׁיב׃

H369אֵ֥ין’ên   (Adv)
H369 אַיִן ʼayin ah-yin as if from a primitive root meaning to be nothing or not exist; a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle; else, except, fail, (father-) less, be gone, in(-curable), neither, never, no (where), none, nor, (any, thing), not, nothing, to nought, past, un(-searchable), well-nigh, without. Compare אַיִן. 		אֵ֥ין’ên no one Adv
H7725לְהָשִֽׁיב׃lə-hā-šîḇ.   (Prep-l | V-Hifil-Inf)
H7725 שׁוּב shûwb shoob a primitive root; to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again; ((break, build, circumcise, dig, do anything, do evil, feed, lay down, lie down, lodge, make, rejoice, send, take, weep)) idiom again, (cause to) answer (phrase again), idiom in any case (wise), idiom at all, averse, bring (again, back, home again), call (to mind), carry again (back), cease, idiom certainly, come again (back), idiom consider, phrase continually, convert, deliver (again), phrase deny, draw back, fetch home again, idiom fro, get (oneself) (back) again, idiom give (again), go again (back, home), (go) out, hinder, let, (see) more, idiom needs, be past, idiom pay, pervert, pull in again, put (again, up again), recall, recompense, recover, refresh, relieve, render (again), requite, rescue, restore, retrieve, (cause to, make to) return, reverse, reward, phrase say nay, send back, set again, slide back, still, idiom surely, take back (off), (cause to, make to) turn (again, self again, away, back, back again, backward, from, off), withdraw. 		לְהָשִֽׁיב׃lə-hā-šîḇ. can revoke Prep-l | V-Hifil-Inf
8 Write you also for the Jews, as it likes you, in the king's name, and seal it with the king's ring: for the writing which is written in the king's name, and sealed with the king's ring, may no man reverse.Esther 8:8
Stats
Counts: 205 characters, 35 words, 154 letters, 54 vowels, 100 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְ֠אַתֶּם כִּתְב֨וּ עַל־הַיְּהוּדִ֜ים כַּטֹּ֤וב בְּעֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ בְּשֵׁ֣ם הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְחִתְמ֖וּ בְּטַבַּ֣עַת הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ כִּֽי־כְתָ֞ב אֲשֶׁר־נִכְתָּ֣ב בְּשֵׁם־הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ וְנַחְתֹּ֛ום בְּטַבַּ֥עַת הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֵ֥ין לְהָשִֽׁיב׃

Lit: And You write a decree concerning the Jews as you please in name of the king and seal it with signet ring of the king for whatever that is written in name of the king and sealed with signet ring of the king no one can revoke

KJV: Write ye also for the Jews, as it liketh you, in the king's name, and seal it with the king's ring: for the writing which is written in the king's name, and sealed with the king's ring, may no man reverse.
References

"in the king's name"
Es 3:12: Then were the king's scribes called on the thirteenth day of the first month: and there was written according to all that Haman had commanded to the king's lieutenants: and to the governors that were over every province: and to the rulers of every people of every province according to the writing thereof: and to every people after their language; in the name of king Ahasuerus was it written: and sealed with the king's ring.
1Ki 21:8: So she wrote letters in Ahab's name: and sealed them with his seal: and sent the letters to the elders and to the nobles that were in his city: dwelling with Naboth.

"may no man reverse"
Es 8:5: Said: If it please the king: and if I have found favour in his sight: and the thing seem right before the king: and I be pleasing in his eyes: let it be written to reverse the letters devised by Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite: which he wrote to destroy the Jews which are in all the king's provinces:
Es 1:19: If it please the king: let there go a royal commandment from him: and let it be written among the laws of the Persians and the Medes: that it not be altered: That Vashti come no more before king Ahasuerus; and let the king give her royal estate to another that is better than she.
Da 6:8: 12-15: Now: O king: establish the decree: and sign the writing: that it not be changed: according to the law of the Medes and Persians: which alters not.
2Ti 2:19: Nevertheless the foundation of God stands sure: having this seal: The Lord knows them that are His. And: Let every one that names the name of Christ depart from iniquity.
Heb 6:17: 18: Wherein God: willing more abundantly to show to the heirs of promise the immutability of His counsel: confirmed it by an oath:

 וַיִּקָּרְא֣וּ סֹפְרֵֽי־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ בָּֽעֵת־הַ֠הִיא בַּחֹ֨דֶשׁ הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֜י הוּא־חֹ֣דֶשׁ סִיוָ֗ן בִּשְׁלֹושָׁ֣ה וְעֶשְׂרִים֮ בֹּו֒ וַיִּכָּתֵ֣ב כְּֽכָל־אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֣ה מָרְדֳּכַ֣י אֶל־הַיְּהוּדִ֡ים וְאֶ֣ל הָאֲחַשְׁדַּרְפְּנִֽים־וְהַפַּחֹות֩ וְשָׂרֵ֨י הַמְּדִינֹ֜ות אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ מֵהֹ֣דּוּ וְעַד־כּ֗וּשׁ שֶׁ֣בַע וְעֶשְׂרִ֤ים וּמֵאָה֙ מְדִינָ֔ה מְדִינָ֤ה וּמְדִינָה֙ כִּכְתָבָ֔הּ וְעַ֥ם וָעָ֖ם כִּלְשֹׁנֹ֑ו וְאֶ֨ל־הַיְּהוּדִ֔ים כִּכְתָבָ֖ם וְכִלְשֹׁונָֽם׃

H3956כִּלְשֹׁנ֑וֹkil-šō-nōw;   (Prep-k | N-csc | 3ms)
H3956 לָשׁוֹן lâshôwn law-shone or לָשֹׁן; also (in plural) feminine לְשֹׁנָה; from לָשַׁן; the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water); phrase babbler, bay, phrase evil speaker, language, talker, tongue, wedge. 		כִּלְשֹׁנ֑וֹkil-šō-nōw; in their own language Prep-k | N-csc | 3ms
H413וְאֶ֨ל־wə-’el-   (Conj-w | Prep)
H413 אֵל ʼêl ale (but only used in the shortened constructive form אֶל ); a primitive particle; properly, denoting motion towards, but occasionally used of a quiescent position, i.e.; near, with or among; often in general, to; about, according to, after, against, among, as for, at, because(-fore, -side), both...and, by, concerning, for, from, idiom hath, in(-to), near, (out) of, over, through, to(-ward), under, unto, upon, whether, with(-in). 		וְאֶ֨ל־wə-’el- and to Conj-w | Prep
